boardgame.name: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Exclusive Queenie 2020: Dice Shrine Chambers
boardgame.description:
The dice shrine chambers can be used with the Escape base game (either the original or any of the Big boxes), offering additional challenges. They require the 8 dice from Escape: Roll & Write in order to use them.

During setup, add the dice shrine chambers to the chamber stack and place the 8 dice off to the side. Once a dice shrine chamber is discovered, two of the set-aside dice are rolled and placed on the shrines in the chamber. Adventurers in the chamber can use the indicated number of dice that match the face shown on the die in the shrine to activate the shrine, gaining the bonus shown on the shrine, then the die is removed. The bonuses are: a gem, movement to an adjacent room without requiring the matching dice symbols, a treasure, rerolling all players' cursed dice, or keeping the die from the shrine as an extra die.

The dice shrine chambers can be used with any combination of expansions or Queenies.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box Second Edition

boardgame.name: Logitac
boardgame.description:
A chess-style abstract strategy game played on a pyramid of four boards: 12x12, 8x8, 5x5 and 1x1. Each player has a pyramid (king), a cube (rook), a cylinder (bishop), a double-pawn (knight) and 44 pawns, and the winner is the player whose pyramid ascends to the fourth (1x1) board.

The game starts with each player's pyramid, cube, cylinder and 12 pawns arranged on the first (12x12) board; the remaining 32 pawns and the double-pawn start off the board and can be introduced on the owning player's back rank in lieu of a move. A player's piece can ascend to a higher board only when two pawns or one major piece belonging to that player have been captured. Otherwise pieces move approximately as their chess equivalents, although pawns gain the ability to move in more directions when they ascend to smaller boards.

boardgame.name: The Baby of Can Guru
boardgame.description:
User Summary

The Baby of Can Guru is a side scrolling game, in which the player controls a kangaroo.

boardgame.name: Tiny Epic Pirates: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Tiny Epic Pirates is a 45 minute, 1-4 player game of high-seas adventure, utilizing a variable rondel action system and action combo-ing! In Tiny Epic Pirates you take control of a Pirate ship with the goal of burying vast amounts of wealth on secret island hideaways.

Each turn, you move your Captain Token around your ship’s action wheel (rondel), selecting which action to perform... Plunder, Trade, Crew Up, Attack, or Search. Each player has a randomized and unique arrangement of these actions on their rondel. Sailing your Pirate Ship is something every player can do every time they take an action.

Plundering allows you to acquire booty from settlements at a very reasonable rate. It’s amazing how negotiating changes when your blunderbuss is at the ready. A crate of gunpowder for a promise of no harm? Fair exchange. Trading allows you to sell your ill-gotten goods to the Black Market for gold. Each Market is only interested in a specific good, so make sure you are sailing in the right direction. Timing is everything, sell your good at the wrong time and it’s worth a pittance. Crew Up adds a new crew member to your growing Pirate Ship. Crew increases your ship’s combat advantage and unlocks new abilities for each spoke of your ship’s action wheel, making that action more powerful every time you take it! Attacking Merchant Ships and other Pirates will grow your reputation. It also happens to be a great way to score some gold and more booty to sell. Be enough of a menace and you may just become a Legend of the Sea!

Search the high-seas for treasures left behind by the unfortunate souls that preceded you. Salvage old ship parts for temporary aid or get lucky and find something worth selling.

The end of the game is triggered once a player has buried three treasures. To do this, a player must first acquire the amount of gold required to bury at the various bury spots on the map. After all players have had an equal number of turns. The player who has buried three treasures wins the game. Ties are decided by the player who has the highest legendary status, followed by which player has the most gold.

Includes the Crimson Silver Mini-Expansion.

--description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dulcedo Cogitationis
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Dulcedo Cogitationis is a Shoot 'em Up.

boardgame.name: Yotal
boardgame.description:
An abstract strategy game somewhat resembling checkers: each player has 20 pieces and the winner is the player who gets more of their pieces to the far side of the board. On their turn each player moves one of their pieces to an adjacent space, or captures an opposing piece on an adjacent space.

The board is a tessellation of 188 triangles, and the unique factor of the game is that each space of the board is coloured one of five colors (red, orange, yellow, green, purple) and each piece can only enter three of the five colors.

boardgame.name: Finglebruggle's Phantomball Field
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 2 Border Kingdoms Adventure

The heroes are pulled into a fast-paced sport played in certain parts of the Border Kingdoms. But the trophy, the community's pride and joy, is stolen by a vengeful wizard who challenges the party to retrieve it in his own private “Finglebruggleball’ dungeon. Can the heroes use their newly acquired sports skills to overcome the wizard's deadly traps and mysteries?

boardgame.name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – Additional Damage Decks
boardgame.description:
Play larger Tripods & Triplanes battles with each player controlling their own set of damage cards.

Each pack includes a full set of Tripod and Airplane damage decks, also compatible with normal WW1 Wings of Glory games.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack

boardgame.name: Eye of Darkness ~ Heart of Light
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 2 Border Kingdoms Adventure

Undead hordes continue to ravage Blackbarn, but hope exists. To the north in the deep wood lies a ruined tower, and within a nearly-forgotten item is rumored capable of drawing the walking dead to it. Can you find the Eye of Darkness and harness its dark energies for the good of Blackbarn?

boardgame.name: Ancient Rivals
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Tier 3 Border Kingdoms Adventure

A chilling darkness continues to creep across the Border Kingdoms. House Gilmann, a wealthy merchant house from Emrys, has discovered the members of one of its caravans are possessed by evil spirits. Can you discover the source of the possessions in time to save them?

boardgame.name: 7 Csoda Párbaj: Szóló
7 Wonders Duel: Solo
boardgame.description:
Home alone?
No opponents available to play 7 Wonder Duel with you?
Or maybe your partner / companion beats you every time?

With our editor, Repos Production, Antoine and I have created this mini expansion of 7 Wonders Duel, which allows you to play the game SOLO, facing one of the 5 charismatic leaders.

How does it work?

Gameplay is simple:

Choose or randomly draw the Leader you will face
Each turn, turn over one of the 12 Decision Cards and follow the instructions
The Leader will build the selected card, regardless of whether they have the resources or not. (After all, they are Leaders, they have many privileges) – Sometimes, the Leader will even play twice in a row
Each of the Decision cards indicates the Leader’s choice priorities, as well as the possibility of immediately replaying an additional round.


When we say it is simple, we just mean the rules – not the strategy.
We are just talking about learning the rules, and managing the game elements during the game. We would never have made a solo mode in the “gas factory » style, as is often the case with solo adaptations ?.

To be successful, you need to adapt to the strategy of your virtual opponents, and it will not be Byzantium every day (as Hammurabi said).

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Diadochi Naval Rules
boardgame.description:
Diadochi Naval Rules is a simple set of naval miniatures rules for fleet battles in the Diadochi (Alexandrian Successors) period.

Each side in the battle should consist of squadrons of 8 or more ships.
Ideally, an individual player should command each squadron.
A flagship is designated for each squadron.
Players secretly plot their initial locations on a sketch of the battle area, indicating formation, spacing and locations of flagships.

Scale:
40mm = 1 cable (607.56 ft), or 1:4630.
Designed for 1:1200 miniatures.

TURN SEQUENCE
1. First side command roll(s)
2. First side movement phase
3. First side missile fire
4. First side combat phase
5. Second side command roll(s)
6. Second side movement phase
7. Second side missile fire
8. Second side combat phase

—description from the designer + rules
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

boardgame.name: Battlespace: Ultra Modern Solo Skirmish Game
boardgame.description:
Battlespace is an Ultra Modern military tabletop solo (or cooperative) game.

The player(s) selects 4 pre-made soldiers (a battle card each, containing all the information needed) for his team.
The simple AI directs the opposition, by drawing cards and acting accordingly.

Turns are divided in 3 phases.

Winning is conditioned by succeeding the mission.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Battlespace: SORD Operatives Card Pack Supplement

boardgame.name: Dragon Scary-go-round
boardgame.description:
This is a fun cooperative game in which archers work together to defeat the circling dragon, while avoiding the ghosts.
Reduce the dragon's life to zero before it injures an archer or your run out of time, and your archers will be victorious.
Watch out for the ghosts, if they grab all the archers, that may spell your doom.

How to play
Decide which one of your action card to play to determine the sequence of events.
If you can, grab a book of magic spells to help your archer group out.
With your friends work together to setup your archers so they may attack the dragon at the beginning of the next turn.
If the ghost appears, move the ghosts according to their speed and dice roll. Try not to get caught.

The game is full of choices for the player to make. Choose the right choices to lead your group to success.
Will you let the dragon move first or will you move first to avoid the ghosts?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heroes Among Us
boardgame.description:
Heroes Among Us is a simplistic rule set design to give players a fast pace superhero skirmish game using any miniatures in their collection.

Played on a 2' x 2' table with players fielding 3 - 5, 28mm miniatures per side.

You will need to download the Abilities Chart to play the game.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Heroes Among Us: Villains Among Us

boardgame.name: Heroes Among Us: Villains Among Us
boardgame.description:
Villains Among Us A supplement for Heroes Among Us

Introduces campaign play to Heroes Among Us. Players will take control of a team of super powered beings and battle across a short campaign to see who will come out on top and save or rule Arch City.

In Villains Among Us, players now take part in scenarios to earn VP (victory points) to win the overall campaign. One player will take control of the villains, while the other player represents the heroes.

You will need a copy of the HAU core rules to use this book.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: All About Terre Haute Indiana
boardgame.description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Terre Haute.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Terre Haute, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

boardgame.name: Era of Kingdoms: Inquisition
boardgame.description:
Two new paths to victory await in the first expansion to Era of Kingdoms. Generate Research and Religious Influence tokens to spend on powerful upgrades and new ways to influence other Kingdoms. Choose your religious beliefs bonuses, add followers to your Kingdom, and send heretics to your enemies' land. Make use of innovative thinking to gain advantages in resource yield, governance, military tactics, and architecture. Loads of new events and interactions while keeping the core of the game the same!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: All About Asheville
boardgame.description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Asheville, NC.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Asheville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

boardgame.name: All About Nashville Tennessee
boardgame.description:
Limited Edition promotional board game from 1982 about the city of Nashville.
Each player visits the shops and businesses and collects cards as detailed on their shopping list.
The first to return home to their residence with the travel cards for all the locations on their list, wins.

The locations and streets are real businesses in Nashville, and this game was made as a promotional item for the area.

boardgame.name: Sooth Sayer: A Character Expansion for Five Leagues from the Borderland
boardgame.description:
This expansion pack adds the Sooth Sayer: A magic user capable of predicting the future.

Sooth Sayers can be added to any war band, whether you are just starting a campaign or far along your adventure.

Included are character creation and campaign notes, new items to bolster your magical recruit and abilities that are beneficial both on and off the battle field.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Expansive Universe
boardgame.description:
A galaxy of adventures awaits in Expansive Universe.

This is a sandbox adventure card game that has many paths to victory: explore your planet, attempt missions on enemy planets, dominate the galactic core with your armada, or engage in ground combat. Assemble your crew, and build your fleet. Unlimited science fiction stories are contained in Expansive Universe.

Each player chooses a faction. Each faction starts with a planet, a spaceship, a location, and the alpha character. The rest of the cards for each faction that is being played get shuffled into the main deck. Every turn, cards from the main deck are auctioned and come right into play when bought. Players can choose whether they want to build a fleet of ships, a crew of space explorers, or maximize gold production.

The sandbox style card game features a point system, so players can get points by exploring, doing missions, winning space battles, winning ground combat, or controlling the galactic core. Every game is different.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Hand You're Dealt: Determining Ability Scores by Playing Cards
boardgame.description:
"You can roll dice, spend points, or just take the Standard Array, but when's the last time you tried something new when creating a new character? Something that actually involves making meaningful choices, but also keeps things interesting with a little random chance? This supplement provides just that: A way to generate ability scores in the form of a fast, easy, and engaging solitaire card game.

The PDF includes an intro explaining why you might want to use playing cards to determine ability scores, explains the simple rules, walks through two example rounds, and presents some optional rules for more intricate play."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Mitsudomoe
boardgame.description:
OVERVIEW

Lay stepping stones (rings) for your trio (balls) to walk and vault their way to the opposite corner. Inconvenience your opponents by covering their rings with yours, and by relocating their balls as you spring over them!

GOAL

Get all 3 of your balls to your goal spaces opposite your starting corner, or be the last player remaining in the game.

EQUIPMENT

1 gameboard depicting a 5 × 5 grid, 12 balls (3 each in black, white, red, yellow), 32 rings (8 each in black, white, red, yellow), carrying case.

GAMEPLAY OVERVIEW

On your turn you place or move a ring of your colour, and jump with one of your balls over other balls, relocating the jumpee balls somewhere else.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: DR Ramasjang
boardgame.description:
Adventure game, where you have to act fasts, smart and avoid beeing eaten!

DR Ramasjang is the land, where children kan meet all the famous figures like Bruno and Monster. Ramasjang is never boring nor standing still. I the Ramasjang game you'll arrive in the land of Ramasjang and help the inhabitants finding things from the well know TV shows, while you flash through secrets portals.

Each player starts by choosing a player board and three different random tokens. These are the secret things you need to find to win the game.

The youngest player starts the game, and each player takes turn rolling the dice moving around the Ramasjang Island. Each stop, has a secret token that can be turned. If the tokens mach one of the three tokens on the player board, the player may keep it, if not - it is placed on the board again. When all three tokens are collected, you must travel to the center of the Island to win.

Flash spots on the board provide secret passages to other flash spots, and if you roll a 6 - you may move the monster and catch and eat another player or block the way! Any player who's taken by the monster, must return to his starting area of the board and wait one turn before entering the island again.

boardgame.name: Civilization VI - Maya & Gran Colombia Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Adding the Maya and Gran Columbia civilizations as well as two leaders (Lady Six Sky and Simón Bolívar) as well as a new game mode: Apocalypse Game Mode, which adds forest fires and meteor showers as disaster types to all games as well as an optional game mode which includes new disasters, larger versions of disasters, new units, sacrifices - and an apocalypse!

New units, resources, natural wonders and city states are also added.

Part of the New Frontier Pass DLC.

boardgame.name: Civilization VI - Ethiopia Pack
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





User Summary

Adding a new civilization, a new leader and a new game mode (Secret Societies) as well as new district and infrastructure to the game.

The new game mode will require either Civilization VI - Rise and Fall or Civilization VI - Gathering Storm expansions.

It is a part of the Nwew Frontier Pass DLC.

boardgame.name: Ambush Sites Multi-Pack
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

Did you hear that?

The best attack is a surprise attack! Whether the heroes step into or launch such an attack. Pathfinder Flip-Mat: Ambush Sites has you covered. The four sides of this Flip-Mat present a variety of places where ambushers might lurk. From a foggy city street and a desert canyon to a thick forest and a mountain pass, a whole world of bushwacking is at your fingertips. With these handy maps, you'll be ready for anything the next time your players are looking for trouble or ready to deliver it.

boardgame.name: Le Manipulateur
boardgame.description:
Abstract connection game played on a 17x17 board. Each player has a "Manipulator" piece which moves by making a rook move, then dropping a pawn on the square arrived on, then making a second rook move at right angles to the first.

On a player's turn they either move their Manipulator in the manner described, or they capture one or more opposing pawns by making a jump or series of jumps with one of their own pawns in a manner similar to checkers. Pawns cannot move except to capture and the Manipulators cannot capture.

A player wins when their pawns either form an unbroken chain from one side of the board to the other, or have trapped the opposing Manipulator so that it cannot move.

Winner of the "Pion d'Or 1983" award from "Jeux & Stratégie" magazine.

boardgame.name: Escape: Queenie Box
boardgame.description:
All Queenies that were released after the Escape Big Box 2nd Edition in one convenient box!

11 – The Cursed Gems
12 – The Slide
13 – The Map
14 – The Wishing Well
15 – New Quests
16 – New Traps


With this and the Big Box, players will have everything that is available for Escape.

The Escape Queenie Box is also a great addition for players who only own the base game and want new modules to add to their adventures.

Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems is already included in the Big Box, but is such a popular Queenie that we wanted to include it for all players to enjoy.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Big Box Second Edition
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 11: The Cursed Gems
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 12: Slide
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 13: Map
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 14: Wishing Well
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 15: New Quest Chambers
Escape: The Curse of the Temple – Queenie 16: New Traps

boardgame.name: Boarding Action
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The X-434Z prison ship holds some of the most dangerous criminals in the Sonora sector. Recent escapes from prison worlds in the sector have led to authorities placing the worst offenders on a ship that rarely visits port anywhere in the sector. But a small group of rebels have discovered that the ship will be in a certain system at a certain time. They want a political prisoner held aboard the ship to be brought out of the ship alive. They are willing to pay handsomely.

boardgame.name: Six Seasons In Sartar
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Sartar, 1619 ST.

A group of young people come of age in an isolated mountain clan. They are the first generation born and raised after the Lunar Conquest, and saw their people bleed and die in Kallyr of Kheldon's failed rebellion. Yet Kallyr still believes she is the one destined to liberate Sartar and Fate - or Luck - is about to to put these young Sartarites in her path.

boardgame.name: The Corn Dolls: Sandheart Volume 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A pestilence threatens the crop at Cliffheath. It festers at the very edge of Sun County and the Sandheart Militia are sent to investigate. Their orders are simple – purge the area of disease. But what caused it and where is the source? The clock is ticking. Can the militia solve the mystery before the situation spirals out of control?

The Corn Dolls is an investigation-based adventure set in the district of Sandheart (detailed in [Tales of the Sun County Militia – Sandheart Volume 1]). It is a non-linear adventure requiring the players to follow leads and react to events. At 45 pages it includes ten handouts/stead maps, a map of Cliffheath, information on each of five farmsteads, key NPC stats and a timeline of events. It is expected to take between two and five sessions to complete.

boardgame.name: Flank the Tiger
boardgame.description:
Flank the Tiger a World War II game with Tanks, lots of TANKS.

There are a lot of rule sets which more accurately capture the combined arms nature of World War II combat, but these rules do not pretend to be one of them.

This game attempts to be realistic-ish in what it represents, swirling tank battles.
But the lack of infantry, artillery, engineering, and air power gives it more of an arcade feel than that of an actual battlefield.

The only intent with this rule set is to give players a chance to use their tank models in a fast and fun game where you get to blow stuff up and maybe even enjoy getting your own stuff blown up.

Flank the Tiger includes vehicle data for 142 vehicles (Germany, USSR, USA and UK) and has pre-filled vehicle sheets for 61 select vehicles (18 Germans, 17 Russians, 12 American, and 14 British).

boardgame.name: Pitter-Patter
boardgame.description:
Pitter-Patter is a dexterity roll and draw area control game for 2-4 players. In the game players are raindrops having a war over puddles on the window pane. Players roll or toss dice onto a paper, drawing puddle around the die where it lands, and trying to push and take control over opponents puddles.

In the files section there are rules for the game. Other than rules, you need 5 dice per player in one color, a piece of paper and a pencil.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Whitestone Ruin: Part One of the Red Deer Saga
boardgame.description:
From the introduction

A source book and scenario set in the Namoldin lands of Arfritha Vale, it details the history of the Namoldin clan and their tribe the Malani, and details some of the settlements of that area.

This document contains the majority of the background and areas of interest, as well as a short adventure which has later repercussions.

boardgame.name: Elgar's Blade: Part Two of the Red Deer Saga
boardgame.description:
From the introduction

This is the second source and scenario book for the Namoldin clan of Arfritha Vale.

boardgame.name: The Duel at Dangerford
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Duel at Dangerford contains a RuneQuest: Roleplaying in Glorantha scenario in three acts by Nick Brooke featuring half the Provincial Army of Lunar Tarsh: Drama! Excitement! Betrayal! Foul Lunar Sorcery! Appendices suggest extra colour (and contain extensive SPOILERS) for two published scenarios: The Smoking Ruin and The Dragon of Thunder Hills. NB: the preview contains SPOILERS, so don't peek if you're a player!

boardgame.name: Jorthan's Rescue Redux
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When a Lunar noblewoman stumbles into your village and asks for your help, saying that her husband has been kidnapped by trolls, what do you do? This is the set-up for Jorthan’s Rescue Redux, an update of Jorthan’s Rescue, the classic RuneQuest mini-scenario by Stephen R. Marsh and John Sapienza Jr. which originally appeared in White Dwarf #19 in 1980. This new version has been rewritten for use with Chaosium. Inc.’s RuneQuest: Roleplaying in Glorantha and relocated to Sartar, whilst retaining the original’s flexibility to be set anywhere where troll brigands might be found. It is a simple, straightforward adventure suitable to be played by characters with a few adventures under their belts.

It includes all new artwork and maps and nineteen NPCs, including two who could become Player Characters.

boardgame.name: Rocks Fall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This short-to-evening-length scenario is designed to slot in to any RQG campaign, as a one-shot fight for those times when a troll cave is absolutely required, or the pacing of the game calls for violence.

Maps, paper miniatures, and full stat blocks are included. An expansion with the full motivations and high quality pictures of all trolls and trollkin is free with the original.

boardgame.name: Stone and Bone
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This full scenario for Runequest: Roleplaying in Glorantha is designed to slot in to any campaign where shamans can be found. It is written with Praxians in mind but can easily be converted to be set elsewhere. A collection of plot hooks is included, along with maps, walkthrough, and suggested aftermath. The adventure will appeal to most characters with an outward bent. Combat is likely, but can be avoided with sufficient cleverness and skill, but it is assumed that danger will be faced. Scaling tips are included to make this a challenge to heavily armed and armoured parties.

boardgame.name: Humakt, Raven, and Wolf
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Humakt, Raven, and Wolf is a playable heroquest for RuneQuest : Roleplaying in Glorantha.

It is based on a Gloranthan myth by Ian Cooper, used by kind permission.

The heroquest can be performed in order to locate something that the adventurers need to find, be it a person or an object. One of the heroquesters must take on the role as Humakt.

This is a short (one session) scenario. The difficulty can be adjusted by the gamemaster by adding or removing combat opponents.

boardgame.name: Rubble Runners: A Collection of Pavic Personalities - Volume 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection 15 highly detailed character descriptions for Runequest Glorantha. Set in the locations of New Pavis, the Big rubble and the Zola Fel valley. These Characters are designed to add depth, realism, their own cadance and a maybe a hint of whismy to a belowed and classic setting.

Written for the years 1625 -1627. Each character is written with a detailed description, full stats, a character illustration, a short summary of supporting characters and character specific encounters/plot hooks.

15 Characters
76 Supporting Characters
77 Encounters & Scenario Hooks

boardgame.name: Hunters of the Sky
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month #4 — April 2020

Hunters of the Sky introduces a strange new species to the skies of Glorantha, the Sky Hunters, and their hunting partners the scarlet falcons. This new bestiary entry includes:

A full bestiary entry for the Sky Hunters describing their life cycle and culture
Three short fiction vignettes, providing an introduction to Sky Hunter mythology
A hunt-band of adolescent Sky Hunters ready to swoop down and devour adventurers

boardgame.name: Night of the Quacking Dead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month #3 — March 2020

Night of the Quacking Dead is designed to start you and your adventurers out on an adventure into the Upland Marsh, home of the infamous necromancer Delecti. This new bestiary entry includes:

Brief summary of the Upland Marsh
A scenario seed in which a new Sword of Humakt, Orlaventus Great-Bill, leads adventurers into the Upland Marsh
Description of three types of undead ducks—duck skeletons, duck zombies, and the awful duck goliath
Cover illustration sans logos, suitable for your coloring pleasure

boardgame.name: Spirits of Madness
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month #1 — January 2020

Spirits of Madness are a type of disease spirit which lurks near places associated with the Moon Rune. This new bestiary entry includes:

Description of the behavior, powers, & possible locations of madness spirits
Gamemaster advice on using disease spirits
The Madness disease, and sample afflictions ranging from paranoia to chaophilia
An example narrative describing an adventurer's combat with a madness spirit

boardgame.name: Geiron, Lord of Elephants
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monster of the Month #2 — February 2020

Geiron, Lord of Elephants is the demigod progenitor of the now-extinct Praxian elephant, a physical and magical Terror associated with the Earth Rune. This new bestiary entry includes:

Description of Geiron—his powers, where he appears, and what he remembers of the God Time
Two adventure seeds to help the gamemaster utilize Geiron in their campaign
A spirit cult by which players can initiate their adventurers into the worship of the Lord of Elephants

boardgame.name: Herb Merchant (薬草ひとついかがですか？)
boardgame.description: A simple card game where you play as a JRPG medical herb merchant, selling herbs to adventurers and making exact change. Coins weigh down adventurers, so try to use as few possible when making change to increase your reputation. Special cards provide useful one-use advantages. The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins!

boardgame.name: Street Masters: Chian and Dan
boardgame.description:
Two winners of a contest had their likenesses immortalized into a pair of Ally/Rival cards for Street Masters.

These cards were available as promotions at GenCon 2019 and as a digital print and play.

boardgame.name: Acooska
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“One second we were watching them sitting on their haunches having a bite, the next we were getting charged by the little bastards, all gurgling and foaming at the mouth. We ran for the river, but before we made it they blew Meera’s leg clean off! We’re lucky that’s all they got.”
- Articus Cooper, Adventurer

Acooskas are raccoon-sized marsupials that live on the edges of forests bordering large meadows or grasslands. They spend the majority of their time foraging in their small territories for fruits and vegetables as well as guarding its perimeters against predators. On the surface, these stumpy animals would seem to be incapable of properly protecting themselves, but they have an explosive means of defending their dens that catches many an adventurer off their guard.

This supplement includes:

Lore and statistics on the Acooska.
Plot hooks to get your party of adventurers involved with this new creature.
An additional swarm stat block for these explosive little critters!

boardgame.name: Return to the Glory
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your people once dominated everything south of the mountains; you had the greatest, most advanced underground stronghold ever known to orc-kind. Then the cataclysm happened. Centuries have passed, and only a few tribes have survived and assembled under the banner of one cause. Reclaim what was once yours!

This adventure is designed for four to six orc characters, levels 6 to 8.

boardgame.name: Infinity's Edge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's Time to Log In and Save the World!

Welcome to Infinity's Edge, where you take on the role of a gamer who's playing a fully immersive virtual reality, massively-multiplayer online role-playing game! Inspired by the LitRPG genre of fiction, Infinity's Edge allows you to play a fantasy hero like never before, one who can discuss levels, gear drops, crafting recipes, and the relative merits of different skills and classes with other players, or even with the NPCs in the game! Death is no longer a barrier, because you'll just respawn, although having to go get your gear from your corpse is a bit of a headache. A much bigger problem might be a rival guild camping a location you need to finish a quest, or the fact that there may be something keeping you from logging out and trapping you in the game!

Infinity's Edge contains all the rules that you need to play a LitRPG-inspired role-playing campaign with your friends, complete with rules for different types of characters, races, classes, equipment, magic, and tons of other goodies. It also includes an example campaign world for you to use if you like, as well as all the tools you need to create your own. Everything is presented in modular fashion so that you can use the systems you like and leave off the ones you don't. It's your game, so make sure it works the way you want it to!

Infinity's Edge uses a percentile based die mechanic with pre-established thresholds that encourage player success. As a character increases their Attributes and Skills through play, their threshold for success increases! They begin as Novices and can gain class abilities as they progress and establish their playstyle through Skills, gear, and other customization options!

boardgame.name: 100 Runestones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It's Time to Log In and Save the World!

In the world of Infinity's Edge, the rarer a piece of equipment, the more likely it is to have Upgrades. And one of the more common Upgrade Slots any weapon, armor, or other item can have is a Runestone Slot. Runestones are versatile items that can add an incredible array of abilities to any item depending upon which one you slot into it. But be careful! Once a Runestone is attached to an item, you can't take it back out!

This product contains 100 different Runestones that Infinity's Edge players might discover during their time spent adventurering in the virtual reality MMO Infinity's Edge, all based on their approximate level and the level of the gear thier quests grant them.

boardgame.name: Knights of the Edge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hoist your banner and draw your steel!

The world of Infinity's Edge needs heroes!

When the monsters of the wild come hunting and find innocent villagers in their path to slake their hunter, who will defend them? Adventurers are fickle and chaotic beings, just as likely deep inside some lost dungeon as nearby when the trouble starts. No, when one's need is at its greatest, only a knight will do.

Most players flock to Guilds and join Factions, but why do that when you could instead be part of a Knightly Order, with all the bonuses and abilities that come with it? Specialized equipment, unique character abilities, and a limited selection of unique Specialist Classes that are available to membesr are only some of the perks.

boardgame.name: The Next Level
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to The Next Level!

In the world of Infinity's Edge, every quest, every encounter, and every session is designed to help your character get that next level! As the newest and greatest VRMMORPG (Virtual Reality Massively-Multiplayer Online Role-playing Game), Infinity's Edge is constantly introducing new content for its players. New Ancestries, new rules for settlements, new rules for guilds, and the rules for using and creating Advanced Classes are here at last!

The Next Level is the first sourcebook for Infinity's Edge, the tabletop role-playing game of LitRPG fiction, wherein you take on the role of a player's avatar in a virtual fantasy world. Loot drops, corpse runs, quests, and even lag can thwart you at every turn, but with a strong party and a little careful consulting with NPCs, you can overcome almost anything! Get your next level so you can tackle that new dungeon in the next zone over before a rival guild gets there first and claims the first Legendary loot drop on the server!

boardgame.name: Kaiju Crisis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Kaiju. Giant monsters. They sound awesome, until they rampage downtown and plow through all your favourite buildings.

Monster Archipelago was supposed to contain it. But something happened, and now the kaiju's moved into town. What is it doing here? What is the military doing about this crisis? And more importantly: what can you get out of it and survive?

boardgame.name: Somewhere in Noctis-Qianjiao
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Firewall has specialists for everything. There are hired guns who can kill anything, corporate bigshots feeding funds and info to their proxies, scientists studying things most transhumans can't comprehend... whether it's infosec, data smuggling, or just someone who can play the cello, if Firewall could possibly need it, they have highly-trained Sentinels primed and ready to go at a moment's notice.

But none of those guys are available right now. You are.

Something big is going down, and it all starts in your slice of Noctis-Qianjiao. You might not be perfect for the job, but imperfect and nearby will do in a pinch. Not a good time? Tough shit, buddy—you knew the risks when you signed up, and if you don't fix it you're probably fucked anyway. So suck it up, join up with the other Sentinels you've probably never even met, and try not to turn this into a fiasco.

boardgame.name: Epic Legacy Campaign Codex
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Running a game of Epic Legacy is challenging. The characters are stronger than ever, the fights are more complicated, the stakes higher than they have ever been, and you just realized you forgot the extra d6s for the meteor swarm–obsessed wizard. It can be enough to make even the most experienced DM balk at picking up Epic Legacy. Steel yourself, aspiring Epic DM, for the Epic Legacy Campaign Codex is here to guide you through these perilous waters.

boardgame.name: Mother of Frankenstein
boardgame.description:
Inspired (but not entirely beholden to) the incredible real life of Mary Shelley, Mother of Frankenstein is a 10-15 hour experience for 1-6 players (ages 13 and up), designed by Terry Pettigrew-Rolapp and Tommy Wallach of Hatch Escapes, creators of LA Magazine's top-ranked escape room, Lab Rat.

Mother of Frankenstein challenges you to solve a series of puzzles in order to learn the truth behind Shelley's infamous monster. While challenging enough for serious puzzlers, it also features a rich, emotional narrative composed by New York Times bestselling YA novelist Tommy Wallach, which will have you and your loved ones feeling all the feelings.

The game is divided up into three acts, each of which contains a trove of documents and puzzles, all of them beautifully crafted and cunningly designed--ostensibly by Mary Shelley herself--in order to reveal a great secret she left to her only surviving child. A bonus edition also includes a full copy of the 1818 edition of Frankenstein with additional puzzles from Emerald Flame creator Rita Orlov (PostCurious).

Over the course of the game, you'll also build a 500 piece 2D puzzle and a 350 piece 3D puzzle, ending up with a gorgeous recreation of Frankenstein's castle you can keep forever!

Simply put, there's never before been a game like Mother of Frankenstein. See for yourself (and pre-order the game at www.motheroffrankenstein.com).

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Armoured Assault
boardgame.description:
Armoured Assault book provides gamers with additional vehicles not featured in other Great Escape Games publications.

It also contains two new scenarios which allow gamers to field more than on vehicle alongside their infantry platoons on multiple vehicles on there own.

The majority of the vehicles in the book are from the later part of World War Two. These are vehicles that weren't featured in the Orders of Battle given in the rule book or Operation Bagration source book.
Also are included a few vehicles not in the field in large numbers for diversity.

boardgame.name: Operation Bagration: To the Fall of the Reich
boardgame.description:
Operation Bagration to the Fall of the Reich is an Eastern Front Supplement (June 1944 to May 1945) for Rules of Engagement

It includes Orders of Battle for the following forces:

Soviet Rifle, Motorized, Reduced Strength and Partisan platoons.
German Volkssturm, Ruckkampfer and Eastern Waffen SS platoons
Finns, Romanians, Hungarians and Slovaks

boardgame.name: Matchi
boardgame.description:
Matchi is beautifully adorned, simple, 2 player game that is easy to learn, yet flexible in it's strategic options. It's engaging enough for serious players, or casual enough to enjoy while having a conversation with a friend. Not to mention, it's a superb way to pass the time during the current lock-down.

The game is presented in a classic Moroccan style lending an air of timelessness to it. It's perfect for seasoned board game players and for new-comers alike. We especially like that it does not take up a lot of room on the table, so it makes a perfect coffee date companion.

The game comes with 8 full colour hexagon tiles, 6 dice, 4 blue player markers, 4 gold player markers, an instruction booklet (with a thank you page for backers!) and a beautifully presented box that it sure to catch the eye.

The object of the game is to be the first player to get all four of their player markers into the center tile.

Players roll dice, and use the dice to perform 1 of 3 actions.

The actions include placing a player marker on the board, moving a player marker, and attacking an opponents player marker.

While the mechanics are fairly simple, it still allows for several strategic choices throughout the game, but not so many that you end up with decision paralysis.

The game runs between 15-20 minutes each and is suitable for ages 8 and older.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cardtropolis
boardgame.description:
Super Heroes gather, the clock has struck midnight and Cardtropolis is under attack! Led by fearsome bosses like Penny 2020, Sister Blister, and The Machine, these Super-Villains along with their loyal Minions are taking over midtown. The citizens' hopes rest with you. Your task is to use Super Heroes, Sidekicks, and Specials to capture all of the Super-Villains, Minions, and a Crook or two along the way. The safety of Cardtropolis is in your hands!

This turn-based card game can be played as free-for-all between opposing players or in team vs. team mode where players cooperate with their teammate to outwit and outplay the other team.

Each turn you must decide to capture a weak Super Villain immediately with a low power Superhero or wait for the right card to do a Team-Up or a Power-Up play and capture a more powerful Super Villain.

But keep an eye on your captured Super-Villains because players can use a Special and steal them away!

boardgame.name: Four Word Thinking
boardgame.description:
In this frenetic word game, 2 to 6 players race to pair hexagonal tiles bearing two-letter combinations and claim four-letter words as quickly as possible. The domino style of play means every new tile changes the available letters, so players must think FA-ST. Packaged in a distinctive hexagonal box, this fast-paced game takes seconds to learn, minutes to play, and provides endless hours of fun for word-game enthusiasts of all ages.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Sock Race
boardgame.description:
The object of the game is to be the first player across the finish line with the most pairs of socks. A “clothesline” to hang your socks, special play socks, Sock Monkey cards, Wash Day cards, Darn cards and a Sock Hop all guide you through collecting socks, losing your socks, and matching them through cute illustrations and everyday, relatable ideas.

Players move around the Sock Track (game board) and follow the instructions on each square. The player may pick socks from the Sock Drawer, win locks from the Sock Pile, or lose socks to Redhand the Raccoon or the Sock Monkey. If the player crosses the finish line (one lap around the Sock Track) with the required number of socks, they win!

A game of two players will run between 20-30 minutes, 4-6 players complete in just under an hour.

boardgame.name: Tower Enforcer
boardgame.description:
Take the role of a Dungeon Hunter with unique stats and abilities. Battle Towers of increasingly difficult monsters. Work your way up to the Tower Boss and claim the Legendary Items to help you defeat all 7 Towers to gain ultimate victory.

Use your selected Dungeon Hunter and Battle the Tower of your choosing with the Battle Deck. The battle deck consists of Attack Cards and Defense cards. These cards are added to your Dungeon Hunters Corresponding Base Stats. After drawing 5 battle cards the battle begins. Select one of the 7 Towers to Battle.

Play the battle card of your choice down within the energy requirements. A card can only be played if you have the energy equal to the card value. Energy is spent when you play an Attack card. Energy can be gained by playing defense card. If you receive damage when playing a defense card that damage is also dealt to your energy.

Your overall attack towards the monster is your base attack stat plus the attack card you have played. Same for your defense, it is the defense card and your Base Defense stat added together. If your overall attack is higher than the monsters overall attack damage is dealt to the monster. But if the monster has a higher attacking card the damage is dealt to your Dungeon Hunters Health Points. Once the monster's health is brought down to 0 the tower shifts down and you battle the next monster.

Every two monsters beaten the Tower rewards you with a random item that can help you defeat the Tower easier. But while the Tower can help you every 5 turns the Tower throws an Event at you. Events can be good helping you gain health, items or even boost your stats. But just as good as they can be they can also be bad. Removing items, losing health, or even doubling the Monsters stats.

Only after defeating all the monsters and the Tower Boss can you gain a Legendary item to help you Battle other towers. Defeating all 7 Tower will grant you victory!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fistful of Lead: Bigger Battles!
boardgame.description:
What Fistful of Lead Core Rules are to skirmish level wargaming, Bigger Battles is for large scale wargaming.

The beloved Fistful of Lead card mechanics are still there to drive the action, but now each card controls a unit, rather than one soldier.
How many units, you ask? How many cards are in a deck, my friend? Yep. You can play 52 units on a table! That is a bigger battle.

In most games, each player can control up to 5-6 units and their Commanders and Heroes without much trouble.
Games can have up to 8 players without slowing down the game.
Now, you can dig out all your old miniatures gathering dust and have a game ready to go in a few minutes.

Experienced wargamers and new players alike will enjoy this game.
Bigger Battles is perfect for convention games and just one-on-one contests.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Wandering Inn
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

“No killing Goblins.”

So reads the sign outside of The Wandering Inn, a small building run by a young woman named Erin Solstice. She serves pasta with sausage, blue fruit juice, and dead acid flies on request. And she comes from another world. Ours.

It’s a bad day when Erin finds herself transported to a fantastical world and nearly gets eaten by a Dragon. She doesn’t belong in a place where monster attacks are a fact of life, and where Humans are one species among many. But she must adapt to her new life. Or die.

In a dangerous world where magic is real and people can level up and gain classes, Erin Solstice must battle somewhat evil Goblins, deadly Rock Crabs, and hungry [Necromancers]. She is no warrior, no mage. Erin Solstice runs an inn.

boardgame.name: Royalty: King and Queen Collide
boardgame.description:
Two rulers advance on the battlefield with their retinue of greatest warriors. Each of them prepared for a duel the likes of which none have ever seen. From Chessand the great White Queen marches forth, ready to decimate his brutish opponent with her superior cunning and strategy, while the all-powerful warrior-king The Red King of Hearts advances from Carda with his superior defenses and firepower. Only one shall leave this battlefield alive, but who will it be?

Royalty is a two-player strategy dice game. Use your four dice and the varied abilities of your Heroes to outwit and strongarm you opponent and claim victory! Use these dice to move and activate the abilities of your three wildly different Heroes or go for broke and use them to activate the difficult but powerful abilities of your Royal leader! Defeat your opponent with strategic movements or burst through their forces with cunning force!

boardgame.name: Dungeon Starter Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:
DRAGONLOCK™ Ultimate an interlocking terrain system that allows you to create fully modular, multi-level 28mm scale dungeon terrain for your RPG or wargame on your home 3D printer. Individual pieces links to neighboring pieces with our exclusive Dragonbite™ clips. Each set is delivered as a downloadable .stl file, and once you have the set, you can print as many pieces as you like and never run out or need to purchase more.

A standard wall piece costs around 45 cents in plastic to print yourself, far cheaper than factory made terrain! All of the models shown were printed at 150 micron resolution, a common standard on most economical 3D printers. A nice starter printer that can print these files starts around $220 (see our F.A.Q. for more info on printers, printing costs, filaments, and more, over on the FDG website forums.)

This set includes:

• Straight Wall x6
• Corner x2
• Narrow Pillar
• Doorway with movable/removable door
• 2x2" Tile x6
• Stairs (includes adaptor for miniatures)
• Dragonbite™ Clips
• Instruction Guide

boardgame.name: Heads or Tails: The Monster Dating Game
boardgame.description:
Looking for a new hot date and don't mind them having fangs or claws?

Heads or Tails is a card game in which you’re a bachelor on a dating game show, trying to win a smoking hot monster date! This game encourages improv comedy, laughing, and being social.

The game is played with a player selected as the game show Host, another as the Bachelor, and the rest as contestants!

Each contestant will draw a random Monster card and Personality card. The Bachelor will ask a question, which will be answered by each Monster in clockwise turn order. The Host is encouraged to play up the game and mediate, but it's not required.

Monsters use their Personality cards to add to the humor, while trying to answer questions cleverly as the monster they are. At the end of three rounds, the Bachelor must guess each monsters identity. For each correct guess, the Bachelor gets a point. If the Bachelor guesses incorrectly, than the Monster gets the point unless the Host determines the Monster gave too vague of answers. Additionally, the Bachelor will reward 3 points to their favorite Monster, which can be determined for any reason they see fit (which could also mean, monsters purposely give away their identity, going "all in" for the 3 points.

The game continues, passing the roles of Host and Bachelor clockwise until every player has gotten to play those roles.

At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins!


Features & Benefits *


• Over 1,000 combinations of cards, leading to every experience being a different one! • The entire game in one box, making it extremely easy to carry and play anywhere, any time! • 32 unique monster cards with listed traits to help inform players. • 32 unique personality cards that will encourage comedic results! • 3 prompt cards to help those who struggle with creating questions on their own. • 1 monster reference card to help those that struggle with memorization. • Quick rule card and easy rules to learn, so you can get to playing immediately and never have to read the rulebook again!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Mirror Maze
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A mad wizard ZOROCH has had the body of a beautiful young woman dug up by his evil henchmen. Why did this wizard have this poor beauty dug up? This wizard’s one-sided infatuation runs deep indeed. So deep, he’s willing to fight to the death in his madman’s mirror maze hideout - TO DEFEND HIS BRIDE’S HONOR! Can the PCs survive this trapped mirror maze hideout and rescue this innocent victim? Or will Zoroch trap the party into being his new servitors forever? So many mirrors, so many powers, such little time…

boardgame.name: I Married a Mutated Toad!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Perhaps you’ve faced giant chimeras, atomic zombies, but are you prepared… for 1950s "married life" sitcom with an atomic twist? In “I Married a Mutated Toad” the heroes will assist the professor who... well, the title gives it all away. It’s a short, one-shot adventure for Gramel Books’ setting Attack of the Giant Monsters, for any number of players.

boardgame.name: Beyond Blue
boardgame.description: Beyond Blue is a single-player narrative adventure that takes you deep into our planet’s beating blue heart. Explore the awesome wonder and unbounded mystery that exists within the world’s ocean.

boardgame.name: Warborn
boardgame.description: Deploy for battle in the Variable Armour, a technologically advanced suit of war. With turn-based tactics and quick-fire clashes, lead a strike force of deadly mecha to bring peace to the solar system in a 40-mission campaign. Create your own maps, practice in skirmish, or battle across multiplayer.

boardgame.name: Waking
boardgame.description:
Waking is an emotional action / adventure game five years in the making. Developed by Jason Oda and a small freelance team, the game is the latest highly ambitious project partially funded by Microsoft via the ID@Xbox program.

Build the palace within

Locked in the darkness of a coma, you dream. In the recesses of your mind, voices call you home, beckoning you towards the light and the void beyond. But it is not your time. Not yet.

Waking is a uniquely personal journey of self reflection and remembrance combining third person exploration and real-world meditation. Traverse the twisted pathways of your mind in a quest to wake, and make choices that shape a uniquely individual experience. Along the way, face your fears and desires as you summon memories of loved ones, and do battle with those who would have you sleep forever.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Libram of Lost Spells, Volume 7
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Libram of Lost Spells takes you on a trip through time to reach back to older editions of the 'World's Most Popular Roleplaying Game' and enjoy some of the greatest spells of those days of yore, forgotten to the current game's 5th edition.

We've recreated these spells with great care, bringing them to life again for the 5th edition of the game. Each volume presents 20 "new" spells that you may recognize with great fondness.

Enjoy the nostolgia of these great spells once more or just interject some surprises of new spells into your games today!

boardgame.name: Okko: Oni Hunters
boardgame.description:
Okko – Oni Hunters is a two player cooperative game.
During a 45 minutes game, you will be a hero striding through the lands of the Pajan Empire, looking for clues in order to discover the Oni hidden within the court of the Shogun.

Prepare for investigations, fights and epic journeys in your quest to restore order in the lands of Pajan with our heroes!

But beware, make sure to fulfill your mission quick before the forces of darkness corrupt all human hearts forever...

At the beginning of the game, each player chooses a Hero who seems fit to complete the mission and beat the game board.

A Hero possesses fighting and investigating skills allowing him / her to face enemies as well as solving the challenges on the way.

Moreover, each Hero has a special ability providing an edge in some situations.

Each board represents a specific cycle as they appear in the comic-book. They have their own progression and come with specific enemies and rules.

Heroes must progress in a precise order if they want to gather enough evidence to reveal corrupt courtiers at the court of Pajan.

The game breaks down in several turns during which Heroes must achieve, one after another, the following sequence:

Draw an Enemy card.
Draw an Adventure card and keep it in hand.
Trade an Adventure card with the second player.
Spend 1 day in order to: Draw 2 Adventure cards or Play a Special card or Resolving an Encounter or Move to a new Area.
Potentially remove a Damage token from the Hero’s card.
On the board, face-down tokens represents the various courtiers at the Court of the Shogun.

Each time Heroes complete a challenge, or after they defeated the board’s “boss”, a player can flip a token or more, memorize and place it or them back face down.

At the end of the game, Heroes will have to discover 3 Oni hiding among the Shogun’s courtiers by remembering what they have learned about tokens throughout the game!

—description from the publisher

listing.notes: English. Includes expansions (see below). Base game has seen one playtime. Heroes inn expansion has been openned but not used. Pajan War expansion sealed unopenned. Oni Court expasion sealed unopenned.

boardgame.name: For a Song and a Dance
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

MOVED BY THE MUSIC!

For a Song and a Dance presents feats, talents, magic artifacts, and other rules inspired by hit songs from the 1970s, 1980s, and 1990s. No... it's not a collection of magical mustical instruments and feats or talents that make will make your characters rock stars (although some of could help them along the way)... this is more general material that was literally based on rock, pop, and Christmas songs.

The material in this book is designed for easy incorporation into d20 Modern and other d20 System games that use the feats and talents. In addition to the magic items and feats and talentsw, For a Song and Dance contains a series of tables to randomly generate the qualities of enchanted items of clotheing; tables to randomly generate destruction-methods of artifacts; and a template that lets players convert their character into a disembodied spirit so the character can be played beyond the end of its mortal existence.

boardgame.name: Growth Spurt
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

While headed to the big city, you and your group approach the village of Nodnarb. Screaming is heard and you rush to show off your heroism. As you enter the community, you discover you are too late to save the cobbler but are informed of unusual issues going on in the area...

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition rules for the Filbar Campaign for six, second level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign.

The scenario was one of our standard convention offerings from 2019 and played at quite a few gatherings!

boardgame.name: Roll Low
boardgame.description:
A dice game where players attempt to roll one of several combinations using 7 dice in as few attempts as possible. Scoring is determined by how many rolls a player took to obtain a specified combination.

Roll Low is similar to Yahtzee but has unlimited rolls and allows 1 reattempt with a two point penalty. Roll low has two different scoresheets with different prescribed combinations.

At the start of a players turn, a player rolls 7 dice and determines if a combo can be scored. If so, the player will write a 1 on the scoresheet for the available combination. If a combination can’t be scored, then the player will hold dice of their choosing and reroll the remainder noting the number of rolls that has passed until a combination can be scored.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2019/Spring Parents' Choice Fun Stuff Award Winner

boardgame.name: La Chasse aux Fantômes: Un livre animé
Geisterjagd auf Burg Krähenfels: Ein dreidimensionales Gespenster-Spielbuch mit schaurigen Effekten!
Ghost Hunters!: A 3-Dimensional Game Book
boardgame.description:
Ghost Hunters! is a classical 'roll/spin and move' game, but built in a 3D pop-up book:

You are Ghost Hunters visiting a mysterious castle to hunt and collect ghosts. Ghosts are collected by visiting the squares they live on. Traps can set you back on your task to collect the most ghosts.

There are ghosts of value 1 and 2 plus the super ghost with value 10. Catching the super ghost ends the game. The hunter with the most ghosts (i.e. sum of the collected ghosts values) wins.

At some places, you have multiple options where to go.

boardgame.name: Shitty Mechs
boardgame.description:
A Roll & Write, for 3 - 6 players, about designing and fighting your very own (sh*tty) mechs.

Each player draws their very own Mech before rolling dice to power it up and throw down with friends. All that's needed is two dice per player, a pen or pencil each and a copy of the Mech Design Document.

Also available in the Files Section, if you want something more family friendly - Rubbish Mechs ;it's the exact same game, just without the big and clever swearing - you can even use the same Mech Design Document!

boardgame.name: The Book of Roman Pop-Up Board Games
boardgame.description:
Four spin/roll and move games in one book:

Gladiators, Chariot Race, Escape From Pompeii, and Race for the Throne

boardgame.name: Point Man: WWII Skirmish Rules
boardgame.description:
Point Man is a set of skirmish rules covering the period 1939-1945. These rules are easy to learn and the basics can be taught in as little as five minutes to a novice player.

As easy as they are they feature a movement - fire system that simulates simultaneous movement without record keeping or any of the other typical problems with that sort of system.

The rules also feature detailed weapons charts that allow for the feel of the individual figure. Rules include both aimed and area fire, indirect fire, command and control, armored fighting vehicles, aircraft, hand to hand combat, friendly fire, paratroops, naval landings, field fortifications and combat engineering.

Designed for 20mm minis but can be adjusted to other scales.

Sequence of Play:
Each turn consists of a undetermined
number of phases.
Each phase consists of an Initiative Sub-
Phase, a Declaration Sub-Phase and an Action Sub-Phase

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Armor Heavy Team: Tacforce 2.0 – Armored Warfare 1950-2010
boardgame.description:
Armor Heavy Team is an official updating and expansion of the TacForce rules published by GDW/GHQ and done with the permission of GHQ.

They cover tactical combat from 1950 to 2015.
It is the most detailed set of rules ever written for the open market while still remaining playable.

They are broken down into three levels depending on the amount of detail the GM and players wish.

The rules include sections for

Urban Combat,
Combat Engineering,
Command Control and Communication,
Maintenance,
Night Operations,
Nuclear,
Biological and Chemical
and about every other kind of warfare that we have seen or will see.


While the base game only comes with the classic cold war era vehicles, additional vehicle sets are available.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Fruits
boardgame.description:
Fruits is a game in which we must combine memory and agility to eat the best fruits in the galaxy. At the beginning you will not know the location of the best fruits, but the actions of the dice will provide valuable information that you must remember during the course of the game.

In each turn we will roll the custom die and we will have to perform the action indicated by the die, we will eat the fruit of another player, show one of our fruits, be the fastest to put our hand on the central card, ... at the end of the game we will count the points of the fruits we have eaten and whoever else has will win the game.

Fruits is intended for family audiences, offering games for 2 to 6 players. It is recommended for aliens at least 8 years old, and the game lasts the same as eating a fruit! About 15 minutes savoring it well.

—description from the publisher (Spanish)

Fruits es un juego en el que debemos combinar memoria y agilidad para comer las mejores frutas de la galaxia. Al principio no sabrás la ubicación de las mejores frutas, pero las acciones del dado aportarán información muy valiosa que debes recordar durante el transcurso de la partida.

En cada turno tiraremos el dado personalizado y tendremos que realizar la acción que indique el dado , ya se comernos la fruta de otro jugador, enseñar una de nuestras frutas, ser el mas rápido en pone nuestra mano sobre la carta central, .... al fina de la partida contaremos los puntos de las frutas que nos hemos comido y quien mas tenga ganara la partida

Fruits está destinado a público familiar, ofrece partidas de 2 a 6 jugadores. Está recomendado para aliens de al menos 8 años, ¡y el juego dura lo mismo que comerse una fruta! Unos 15 minutos saboreándola bien.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kapadocja
Kapadokya
boardgame.description:
Kapadokya is a region of Turkey where dozens of balloons take flight every morning to contemplate the first rays of the sun. A beautiful scene that we will be part of with this competitive game for 2 players. Move to the Kapadokya region and help the balloons to land, the more balloons you land, the more points you will have!

Each player on his turn must place a card in the play area that represents a balloon at an indicated altitude and if he gets an indicated number of balloons he will land and with these points that will give him victory at the end of the game



=====================================================

Kapadokya es una región de Turquía en la que todas las mañanas decenas de globos levantan el vuelo para contemplar los primeros rayos del sol. Una escena preciosa de la que formaremos parte con este juego competitivo para 2 jugadores. Trasládate a la región de Kapadokya y ayuda a los globos a aterrizar, cuantos más globos
aterrices, ¡más puntos tendrás!

Cada jugador en su turno deberá colocar una carta en la zona de juego que representara un globo en un altitud indicad y si consigue un numero indicado de globos conseguirá aterrizarlos y con esto puntos que le dará la victoria al finalizar la partida
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

listing.notes: New in shrink

boardgame.name: The Other Road To Arnhem
boardgame.description:
A solo tactical game about the battles and struggles that the 1st Airborne division faced during the first few days of the drops and landings around the Arnhem/Oosterbeek area.

You play as the British in this chit pull, paragraph driven game, the enemy may not be placed on the map until you spot them, or they spot you.

Before the game begins there are decisions to make. Which attached units do you want to add and how much additional ammo do you want to take. These come at a cost of a time/VP deduction.
Flip a chit and obey the instructions, chits allow platoons or groups to be activated, as well as passing of time, mortar actions, minefields and wire activations, random events etc. When one of your platoons is activated you give the platoon one of four orders, Hold, Advance, Assault or Recce. These orders allow your sections to make an action. As well as the usual combat, movement and morale test other actions include spotting and special commanders actions such as the off map 3" mortar and sending a runner to replenish ammo. Certain orders will make the chosen actions easier to execute and more successful. A Hold order for example will not allow a move action, although a regroup action is possible. A Recce order will allow you to spot easier and not to be spotted by the enemy as easily but will not allow you to enter into combat.

After the action phase has been completed for your platoon, a paragraph check is made. This will allow you to spot enemy units, buildings, bridges, be aware of any terrain modifiers within the hex. The level of awareness is attached to the actions and orders of your platoon. If you go charging around the map with an Assault order, don't be surprised to run into mines and wire and making the enemy aware of your position without spotting them in return as well as having less command over these units.

The VPs are directly connected to the number of turns it takes to complete the game. But do not get complacent as you are never sure what lies ahead until you have read that last paragraph.

boardgame.name: Action Castle IV: Escape from Action Castle
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fourth in the Action Castle Trilogy!

Locked away in a tower for nearly 20 years, the Princess of Action Castle is ready to make her escape. You’ll have the time of your life with this 100% Pure Adrenaline Parsely game.

A full color, 12-page PDF. It’s recommended you know the rules of Parsely games before playing.

Genre: Fantasy

Difficulty Level: Intermediate

boardgame.name: Axel Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Time for Annual Evaluations! What could go wrong!?

Welcome to Axel Outpost, cadet. In this adventure for Tiny Frontiers you’ll take Explorers from day jobs at this Outpost on an incredibly wild and dangerous adventure through the various tubes, corridors, and dark alleys that connect this space station in the middle of Neutral Space.

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Avanti – Italian Forces in North Africa 1942-1943
boardgame.description:
The Italians learned about modern warfare the hard way in 1940. Now they are back, showing the world what the Italian soldier can do. Fighting under the famous 'Desert Fox', General Rommel, they form a crucial part of the Italian-German Panzer Army. Tough, determined, skilled, and aggressive veterans, the Italians broke through the British Gazala Line to save the trapped German Afrika Korps, held the line at El Alamein, and opened the way at Kasserine Pass, before holding up the American offensive at El Guettar. Fight or die for the new Roman Empire!

This book gives you a whole new way of fighting in the desert. The Italians are more lightly equipped, but more determined than the Germans and British. Their infantry is as numerous as the Americans, but more experienced.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Flames of War: The World War II Miniatures Game

boardgame.name: Oymyakon
boardgame.description:
Oymyakon, winter of 1926.

Oyamyakon is a semi-cooperative game where we will assume the role of a family from Oymyakon, the coldest inhabited city in the world. The purpose of the game is to survive the low temperatures and to be the family that has lived a winter in the best possible conditions, accumulating more and better resources, for this they must manage to put groups of 3 cards of the same type inside their house and get thus the highest number of victory points.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet

boardgame.name: All-American Gamers Guide
boardgame.description:
All American Gamers Guide (ASL Comp)

Final expansion of the "All American" series, the item crowns the trilogy by providing additional material to this highly detailed historical sequence. It is closely linked to the last issue "Shanley's hill".

28 page long, it contains:

the designer's notes of Shanley's hill from Ian Daglish
a new Campaign Game called "Night Drop"
3 scenarios pitting 'old' Paratrooper scenarios into the real battlefield thanks to the accurate map provided
a Solitaire mission "Group Able south!" using the three previously published maps
and finally an interview of a famous veteran of those days, Robert Murphy.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: All American: The 82nd Airborne at Shanley's Hill – June 6-9, 1944

listing.notes:
