boardgame.name: Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-71
boardgame.description:
Iron and Blood: Easy Rules for Gaming The Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871


Doomed cavalry charges!
Rattling mitrailleuses blasting holes through ranks of spiked-helmeted Prussians!
The deadly accuracy of the Chassepot rifle vs. Krupp artillery!


If you've ever wanted to game the Franco-Prussian War of 1870–71, but were put off by the steep entry cost, this might be what you're looking for.

This is a set of miniatures rules that are easy to learn, completely intuitive, and provide meaningful tactical options for players.

NOTE: This is not a campaign book or scenario book, just a system for running whatever historical or hypothetical battles of the period you please. Army lists are not included!

Minis: designed for 6mm but can be easily adapted

Turn Sequence:

Place Orders
Load Cannons
Move Commanders
Check Orders
Move
Melee
Fire


—description from the publisher and rulebook

boardgame.name: Fantasy City Sites and Scenes II
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb

This companion to Fantasy City Sites and Scenes presents new city locations and encounters that can be dropped into almost any fantasy campaign.

City sites. Each of the sixteen locations detailed in the book is presented on a two-page spread (for a total of 32 pages worth of locations) and includes a few assorted details the gamemaster can use to add flavor to the site, as well as assorted other bits of info that vary from location to location to give the site a little personality. Hooks that may lead to adventure are sprinkled throughout this section of the book.

City scenes. In addition to the city sites, the book also includes fourteen pages of encounter ideas. Divided into two sections -- daytime scenes and nighttime scenes -- this section of the book is for those gamemasters who are looking to throw challenges at the party as they walk the city streets.

This PDF was created thanks to the support of 1,783 backers who joined in the Kickstarter campaign. Thank you to all of the supporters for making that campaign a success!

boardgame.name: Kingdom Death: Monster – Stone Face Base Inserts
boardgame.description:
Hard plastic stone face base inserts:
Stone Face Bases, Unique Stone Face bases, Unique 50mm bases, 100mm base.

boardgame.name: Wars of Yor: Basics
boardgame.description:
Wars of Yor: Basics is a simplified wargame for two or more players with a Rock – Paper – Scissors style format.

Maneuver your armies' units and plan your attacks where you have the advantage.
Calvary beats Infantry, Infantry beats Pikemen, and Pikemen beat Calvary.
Archers plink at range, and die in close combat.

This title includes PDF rules, and STL files for 3D printing the units.

This set includes both full units, or, for those who want to save PLA, minimal unit bases.
Both are the same size bases so you can play with either style, or mixed, with no rule changes.

This set has some custom dice STLs, but they are not needed for play.
You can use regular D6s and consult the Advantage chart for results.
The dice are designed in a way to allow for as much randomness as possible, but nothing beats a casino D6 for impartial rolling.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Barrow Builders
boardgame.description:
You have been hired to build a henge atop a barrow within a single year, taking one turn for each month. Using the runes to guide you, create different stone configurations and place them on the barrow mound.

There are three different types of placements: arches, standing stones, and round stones. There are three different colors of stones: exotic blue, polished white, or common dark gray.

You play by pulling any of the 24 Elder Futhark runes out of a bag. Each turn drawn two runes. The first rune drawn determines the placement, while the second rune drawn determines the color.

There is a chart provided for using dice: one eight-sided die and one six-sided die, if the player doesn't have access to any runestones.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Bloodfields
boardgame.description:
All known dimensions of the multi-realm branch out from one place. The Bloodfields. Their endless plateaus contain blueprints of all the things that can be. But they come at a cost. The grounds require a never-ending offering of blood spilled in battle.

The first beings born off the Bloodfields had to keep them satiated through gory festivals of violence. Many have died and many have become powerful beyond comprehension, thus becoming Gods.

The Gods have then created other realms. Filled them with magic and creatures of all kinds. But with one selfish purpose in mind. To ensure a never-ending stream of the most valuable resource - blood.

Every war, every disagreement, and even the smallest quarrel between Gods is therefore settled on the Bloodfields. And Gods always bring the greatest warriors from their realms to remain invincible!

This world is driven by conflict.

Bloodfields feature dynamic and simple yet engaging gameplay. To keep things action-packed each skirmish takes up to 60 minutes and features a team of chosen ones on each side.

To make every Bloodfields experience truly unique, there is a wide range of scenarios that enhance the gameplay. Each scenario has its individual rules, dedicated terrain, and surprising events. It’s up to you to prepare the winning strategy for each occasion, whether it is an endless siege or escorting a deranged mage.

boardgame.name: The Siege Perious Hawkwind's Gazeteer: Sosaria
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An interpretation of the Ultima: Age of Darkness Games (1-3)

These rules and settings use content from the first three Ultima CRPG games: Ultima I – The First Age of Darkness, Ultima II – Revenge of the Enchantress and Ultima III – Exodus. These three games were released from 1980 through 1983 and formed the basis for the wildly popular Ultima series and the Ultima On-line MMORPG.

boardgame.name: Menagerie of Minor Magic
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb:
Everyone knows the enchanter can create some amazing works of magic. But not everything turns out the way its creator wants. And sometimes, people want some really dumb things, at least by other people’s standards.

Adventurers are happy when they find a powerful sword, a shield that makes them legends, or a staff that shakes the foundation of the world. But not all magic items are so magnificent. Since permanent enchantments can outlast the purposes of their creators, it’s reasonable to assume the fantasy world is riddled with unusual magic items of a much less impressive nature.

This volume contains 100 such “treasures” – some of them are quite useful to a creative adventurer, and others… well… somebody wanted it made…

Originally released by Arnold Kemp on his blog, GoblinPunch.BlogSpot.com, and edited for use with the BareBones Fantasy Role-playing game, this book is a great resources for Game Masters needing that creative spark!

boardgame.name: Dramatis Personae Volume #1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Volume #1 includes stats, backgrounds, personality profiles, and adventure hooks for 15 anime and manga characters, built up from the race and class templates introduced in BESM Fourth Edition.

boardgame.name: Dramatis Personae Volume #2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Volume #2 includes stats, backgrounds, personality profiles, and adventure hooks for 15 anime and manga characters, built up from the race and class templates introduced in BESM Fourth Edition.

boardgame.name: Dramatis Personae Volume #3
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Volume #3 includes stats, backgrounds, personality profiles, and adventure hooks for 15 anime and manga characters, built up from the race and class templates introduced in BESM Fourth Edition.

boardgame.name: Dramatis Personae Volume #4
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Volume #4 includes stats, backgrounds, personality profiles, and adventure hooks for 15 anime and manga characters, built up from the race and class templates introduced in BESM Fourth Edition.

boardgame.name: Manor of Blood
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

A clan of vampires is plaguing the land? Can you infiltrate their manor house and kill the Master Vampire?

Manor of Blood is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: Castle of the Dead
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

An undead horde has awoken from its ancient slumber in a nearby abandoned castle. Will you, brave hero, be able to quell this threat before they invade town?

Castle of the Dead is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: Crypt of the Damned
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Something evil lives within the crypt beneath the cemetery. Some believe the crypt connects with the sewers beneath the city streets. Can you delve into the darkness and investigate the horror before it starts to kill?

Crypt of the Damned is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: Orcs of the Forge
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

An Orc Clan is preparing for war. You alone have discovered the hidden forge where they are building their weapons. Can you kill the Forge's Warlord and stop the war before it begins?

Orcs of the Forge is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: Tabletop Gaming (Issue 43 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
Tabletop Gaming
June 2020

Mythos: We Reveal What is Lurking in the Shadows
boardgame.rpg: Jim Henson's Labyrinth: The Adventure Game

boardgame.name: Warren of the Rat King
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Hordes of rats have been stealing cheese, bread, and even animals from the local village. However, when small children begin to disappear, you take it upon yourself to track down their nest and kill them once and for all. Can you overcome the swarming hordes of the Rat King's Warren?

Warren of the Rat King is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: Lair of the Lizardmen
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

A dungeon lies within the depths of the jungle. The mayor believes that a clan of Lizardmen is kidnapping people from town and taking them there. Can you defeat the Lizard Warlord and save the people?

Lair of the Lizardmen is a Micro Chapbook RPG--an ultra-light roleplaying game that fits in a single folded chapbook. Simply print off the two rules pages back-to-back, fold in half, and you have a completely playable Micro Chapbook RPG.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: System Breach
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Something has breached your security barriers on your starship? You fear it is your dreaded enemy, the Klartorlians. Can you search the ship, find these aliens, and kill them before they kill you?

System Breach is an ultra-simple science fiction roleplaying game where you explore your own ship in search of unwanted aliens on board. It can be played solo or with a traditional GM if you so wish. This game is based on the extremely popular grimdark fantasy Micro Chapbook RPG system.

These rules are specially designed for solo play on a grid map or graph paper but may also be used as quick and simple rules for a traditional GM run RPG game. Combine with other Micro Chapbook RPGs for extra options!

This file includes both the full-color and printer-friendly versions.

boardgame.name: The Game Developers!
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You’re game developers for Sorcerers of the Flyover States (SotFS). You've been wasting time and you need to get a
game out TODAY. Unfortunately, you’re all working from home. Join your coworkers on a teleconference call and develop
your game. No matter how half-assed it is, someone will buy it. In fact, under the right circumstances, you can make more
money with a bad game than a good one. The only thing that really matters is getting your name on the cover in a big
letters. Big letters mean big things for your career! Are the people on the inside cover even worth talking to?

boardgame.name: Trouble in the Basement
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Trouble in the Basement is the first in what we hope to be a series of fictional adventures for Hero Kids.

This is not a roleplaying adventure for your young heroes to play, but a story to read (or listen to) and enjoy. The story is in a relatively new genre called LitRPG—a story that includes obvious elements from the roleplaying game on which it is based.
Introduction

This short story introduces the reader to a few of the young heroes in Rivenshore and the types of adventures they have. The adventure takes place in the basement of the Block and Tackle Tavern and the newly discovered caves leading out from it.

Although this story is loosely based on, and is a prelude to, the Basement O' Rats adventure available with the Hero Kids core system, it should not ruin that adventure for your young heroes. If you read this to them (or they read it themselves) before playing the adventure, it should spark their imagination and desire to find out for themselves what's going on beneath the Block and Tackle Tavern. Reading this story after playing the adventure will provide the excitement of seeing how the bigger story fits together and to compare experiences.

We have tried to give a sample of the Hero Kids system and roleplaying, while changing up the story and leaving options to the readers' imaginations (like how they might have used food in their inventory).

It is our intention and hope that this short story encourages young heroes to experience adventures for themselves, turn those adventures into their own stories, and to tell those stories to others.

Reader Level Note: Trouble in the Basement is about 5500 words (about half the length of a “chapter book”), has a Flesch Reading Ease of 89.6, and Flesch-Kincaid Grade Level of 3.1.

No other materials are required to enjoy this product, but you will want to buy the Hero Kids core system once you read it.

boardgame.name: Yuletide - An Uninvited Guest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

In Yuletide: An Uninvited Guest

The heroes find more excitement than expected while fetching a tree for the Yuletide celebration.

They must rescue the woodcutter, who has been captured by a witch and are followed home

by another young hero from an alpine village who has become lost and has been running from timber wolves.

When the Yuletide festivities are disrupted and the tree destroyed, some suspect the alpine visitor,

but the real uninvited guest is the witch’s familiar, sent to get even with the meddlesome heroes.

Through the adventure, the heroes learn to defend someone unlike them and gain understanding

for those who can be unkind because they are under too much pressure, rather than being a bad person.
What's inside this "super premium" adventure?

25 Encounters for 120 to 240 minutes of fun!

7 custom maps

9 new items

2 new NPCs

6 new monsters

3 new skills

boardgame.name: Carpet Bocce
Carpet Boules
boardgame.description: For those of you who enjoy playing bocce ball, outdoors in the summertime, here is a way to play all year round in the comfort of your living room. This miniature version of bocce ball is a fun way to get the whole family involved in the excitement of seeing who can get closest to the pallino. On those cold winter days, or during the rain-soaked springtime, never worry about getting in a friendly game of bocce again. A fun family game of dexterity for 2-4 players.

boardgame.name: Dangers Near and Far
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

A compilation of Scenario Packs and tools for game masters in games of Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures.

The world is perilous and vast…

Wicked goblins and capricious fae threaten the village. Your neighbors have troubles of their own and need your help, whether they know it yet or not. Sometimes, the very dead rise as ghosts or shambling corpses, seeking to break down the veil between life and death. Heroes of your quality are rare and needed.

Meet new heroes, young and old...

Dangers Near and Far compiles all of the free material from four addons for Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures, and gives more besides. This volume provides a group with new Scenario Packs, Threat Packs, and Character Playbooks, as well as new rules and a host of adversaries for the heroes to face.

• Collected material from Hearths and Homes, The Wicked Dark, Across the Veil, and From Distant Lands, including Scenario Packs like the Opened Barrow and the Troubled Village, and Character Playbooks like the Goblins’ Child and the Student of the Dark Arts.
• Two completely new Character Playbooks, the Barbarian Namer and the Lord’s Secret, and three completely new Scenario Packs, the Lordling’s Lament, the Delivery Quest, and the Witch’s Mistake.
• New spells, magic items, and bestiary entries, and rules for goblins, mass combat, traveling to the Underworld, and more.
• Guidelines for making your own Scenario Packs.
boardgame.rpg: Beyond the Wall and Other Adventures

boardgame.name: Graveyard Shift
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

Graveyard Shift is a clandestine mission perfect for introducing players to the horrors of daily life (and death) in the 41st Millennium. Tasked by an Interrogator of the Inquisition to retrieve a dangerous xenotech artefact, the Agents explore a corpse starch production facility, encounter villainous Scum, and scour the dangerous wastes of the Boneyards before confronting the profane dangers of xenos technology.

This adventure can be played as an introduction to Wrath & Glory, or inserted into an ongoing campaign in the Gilead System. The choices the Agents make in the course of this adventure are almost guaranteed to have wider repercussions, as detailed in the Resolution.

boardgame.name: Ekskalibur
Excalibur
boardgame.description:
Publisher's Blurb:

This is a free supplement for the City of Mist RPG, compatible with the Core Books bundle which includes the Player's Guide and the MC Toolkit

This beautifully illustrated character playbook for the City of Mist RPG introduces Excalibur, an old-money socialite and a fierce social activist who has found the ultimate weapon.

Through heading a charitable foundation, her hope is to bring about social change and find better opportunities for the downtrodden populations of the City.

boardgame.name: In the Heart of the Delve & Dangerous
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Heart of the Delve & Dangerous – Procedural point crawl adventure engine for exploring a network of interconnected spaces - e.g. dungeons, space stations or eldritch structures

Basically, in In the Heart of the Delve and Dangerous there are two 'game engines' in the form of Hex Flowers. One engine drives locations and the other the encounters.

Each time you move to a new location, you procedurally determine what is there.

boardgame.name: Hall of Law
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A bridge stretches out over small hovels and alleyways leading to the gates of the hall of law. Twin angelic beings stand guard over the entrance, swords crossed above your head. A fountain trickles pleasantly besides two large sets of staircases with lead you into the inner sanctum.

The main hall is wide and circular with small staircases on either side allow access to stands while above them lie the judges box.

boardgame.name: Fortress of Blasted Bones
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A heavy fortification has been built into the dry mountainous cliff-side, the barrels of cannons protruding from small openings. Statues of beautiful angelic figures stand upon pillars of stone and iron while cages designed to house criminals hang from the towers. A massive wooden and iron gate bars the main entrance.

Inside stone staircases spiral up into barracks, cooking and storage areas. The fortress allows for some living space, a small library as well as personal quarters and two cells for prisoners.

boardgame.name: The Titan's Gate
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A heavy fortification has been built into the mountainous cliff-side, the barrels of cannons protruding from small openings. Statues of beautiful angelic figures stand upon pillars of stone and iron while cages designed to house criminals hang from the towers. A massive wooden and iron gate bars the main entrance.

Inside stone staircases spiral up into barracks, cooking and storage areas. The fortress allows for some living space, a small library as well as personal quarters and two cells for prisoners.

boardgame.name: Gates to the North
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A heavy fortification has been built into the snow covered cliff-side, the barrels of cannons protruding from small openings. Statues of beautiful angelic figures stand upon pillars of stone and iron while cages designed to house criminals hang from the towers. A massive wooden and iron gate bars the main entrance.

Inside stone staircases spiral up into barracks, cooking and storage areas. The fortress allows for some living space, a small library as well as personal quarters and two cells for prisoners.

boardgame.name: Remains of the Lightbringer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lightbringer was the fastest ship in the fleet, and had been crafted to resemble an angelic form but the ship has seen better days. Dashed up against the rocks the ship has partial broken in half, spilling it’s contents into the sea.

Below deck the ship has still retained three of it’s set of four cannons even after the deck broke in three and while some of the cargo has been broken, some crates still remain. The captains private quarters are at the far end, housing a small bed, deck full of scrolls and a bookcase.

Adventure Seed

Some months ago the Lightbringer went suddenly missing, the holy fleets finest ship and the vessel carrying the holy books of the god of light. It was assumed that the waves had claimed these holy relics and all hope was lost. However a rumor has spread over the last week that the ships remains have been sighted off the coast of a small fishing village and so you’ve been asked to investigate and recover the holy books if possible.

If you ask around in the village you can find the fisherman who sighted the vessel, and if pushed he’ll confirm that the ship does in fact lie grounded on the coast but claims that when he got closer he saw strange shadows dwelling within and that the ship is cursed. He begs you to avoid the vessel claiming that if intruded upon not only will you suffer the curse but him as well for telling you it’s location.

Months ago It was during a stormy night the Lightbringer saw it’s end, it’s masts broken and thrown into the sea the ship barely made it through the night. Over the coming weeks the crew began to starve and once noble men turned on each other. The captain was killed trying to protect one of the weaker shipmates and both he and the shipmate became food to the others soon after. After another month the ship finally ran a ground but not before the former crew had “died” and risen as monsters for their sins.

Hidden within the remains of the lower deck are group of ghouls along with the holy tomes that rest in the captain’s quarters. The ghouls avoid this area at all costs as it causes them pain to be within several meters of the relics.

boardgame.name: The Lightbringer
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lightbringer is the fastest ship in the fleet, and has been crafted to resemble an angelic form, a masthead with arm outstretched, a longsword in hand is the first thing you see of the beautiful ship. It’s railings have been finely crafted to resemble ribbons and six large wooden wings protrude out sides.

Below deck the ship holds a set of four cannons, some hammocks for the light crew and some additional space for cargo. The captains private quarters are at the far end, housing a small bed, deck full of scrolls and a bookcase.

boardgame.name: Volcan's Spear
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Volcan’s Spear is a true feat of magical engineering, and has been crafted to resemble a giant shifting six winged phoenix when viewed from the ground. An angelic masthead with arm outstretched, a longsword in hand is the first thing you see of the beautiful ship. It’s railings have been finely crafted to resemble ribbons and six large marble wings protrude out sides.

Below deck the ship holds a long area flanked by marble statues ending in a large marble throne of the demi-god Volcan himself.

boardgame.name: Murkmire Derelict
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Lightbringer was the fastest ship in the fleet, and had been crafted to resemble an angelic form but the ship has seen better days. Dashed up against the rocks the ship has partial broken in half, spilling it’s contents into the sea.

Below deck the ship has still retained three of it’s set of four cannons even after the deck broke in three and while some of the cargo has been broken, some crates still remain. The captains private quarters are at the far end, housing a small bed, deck full of scrolls and a bookcase.

boardgame.name: Dread Barge of Karn
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Dreadbarge is feared across the nine seas. The ship would look rather mundane if not for the cages hanging from it’s side, often with the dead and dying inside. It’s said a powerful druid controls this vessel hunting down those who they see as not belonging on the oceans waves. Below deck the ship holds a long area flanked by stone statues ending in a large stone throne.

boardgame.name: God of War's Vault
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago built within this demi-plane this ancient vault still remains floating through the aether. Tall stone walls and wide engraved oaken doors bar entrance into the halls, locking away multiple rooms which contain weapons of war as well as magical scrolls of tactical genius used by heroes of the late ages.

The main hall leads you into a large chamber flanked by stone statues and containing multiple pedestals containing weapons said to be used by the god of war himself. His blade of vengeance, axe of brutality, skullcrusher and bastion of the brave.

boardgame.name: Temple of Betrayal
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago built above the desert valley below still lies the ancient Temple of War. Tall stone walls and wide engraved oaken doors bar entrance into the halls, locking away multiple rooms which contain weapons of war as well as magical scrolls of tactical genius used by heroes of the late ages.

The main hall leads you into a large chamber flanked by stone statues and containing multiple pedestals containing weapons said to be used by the god of war himself. His blade of vengeance, axe of brutality, skullcrusher and bastion of the brave.

boardgame.name: Temple of War
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Long ago built above the river valley below still lies the ancient Temple of War. Tall stone walls and wide engraved oaken doors bar entrance into the halls, locking away multiple rooms which contain weapons of war as well as magical scrolls of tactical genius used by heroes of the late ages.

The main hall leads you into a large chamber flanked by stone statues and containing multiple pedestals containing weapons said to be used by the god of war himself. His blade of vengeance, axe of brutality, skullcrusher and bastion of the brave.

boardgame.name: Back Street Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A set of small alleyways lead you to a set of stone pillars which mark the entrance to a grimy back street arena. Crates and barrels have been stacked outside it’s door in a small courtyard area where small flowers poke through gaps in the cobblestone.

Inside lies a circular room with small staircases on either side allow access to stands while a set of steps lies down to the main fighting area. Dried blood covers the floor and sharpened stakes line the walls.

Adventure Seed

Rumors have been spreading of an illegal fighting ring somewhere within the city, however after extensive searching the best the cities guards have come up with is that the location lies somewhere within the slums. They need someone unknown to infiltrate this fighting ring and disclose it’s location to them so they can shut it down, saving lives.

You manage to uncover the fact that the fighting ring changes locations frequently to many abandoned buildings around the city and obtain the current location from a shady peasant. However upon arrive at the location the building is empty and you’re ambushed soon after and knocked unconscious.

You awake within the real arena with crowds of people cheering from the stands. A large man standing above you on a platform explains that he’s taken men and women from the streets who had nothing and gave them at chance at earning wealth and glory. He’s forced no one to fight who didn’t want to and you and your puppet masters want to take away their freedom to choose for themselves.

He tells you he likes you, that you’re a fighter and he wants to see you fight tonight for the crowd, if you do he’ll let you go and that’ll be that. However he warns you that the fights won’t stop until his body is dead and cold, no matter what you tell the puppet masters, by the time they come to clear this place out everyone will be gone.

boardgame.name: Slavers Bay Arena
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beautiful waters full of colorful fish wash up against the wooden piers that mark the entrance to the arena. Crates and barrels have been stacked outside it’s door in a small courtyard area where small flowers poke through gaps in the cobblestone.

Inside lies a circular room with small staircases on either side allow access to stands while a set of steps lies down to the main fighting area. Dried blood covers the floor and sharpened stakes line the walls.

boardgame.name: Undercity Cult Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twisted stone corridors bring you to a large room held up by stone columns, either side of the room lie large stone statues and a fountain trickles pleasantly besides two large sets of staircases with lead you into the inner sanctum.

The main hall is wide and circular with small staircases on either side allow access to stands while above them lie the cult leaders box.

Publisher's blurb:

The May 15, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

Publisher's blurb:

The May 22, 2020 Friday Enhanced Map product contains a multi-layered PDF (allowing the options of white or black backgrounds, numbered or non-numbered areas, secret doors on or off, and grid or no grid) and a zip file with all relevant map files as individual jpg images.

boardgame.name: Waimea Wipeout Surf board Game
boardgame.description: The world's first realistic surfing board game. Featuring the surf photography of Brian Bielmann, the game board and box are covered with magazine quality surf photos, making looking at the game almost as enjoyable as playing it. Roll a 10-sided die and execute the take off, drop and tube of waves on the north shore of Hawaii. If you make it past the barreling tube, you can execute a variety of maneuvers to accumulate points in search of the perfect 10. Additional surf break charts are also available to localize your Waimea Wipeout experience (not included). This is the game for surfers...but not only for surfers. Waimea Wipeout educates even the most novice of fans about the essential elements of competitive surfing, while also giving the chance of victory to all players. Unique would be an understatement for this game !

boardgame.name: Paranauê
boardgame.description:
It is the end of the 19th century and Capoeira, Brazil's cultural heritage today, is unfairly prohibited by law. You are a Mestre in Capoeira and you are about to structure your own roda, but you still need to get some more members, instruments and teachings so that it is fully formed.

Collect materials to make your musical instruments, get parts of clothing to call members to your circle, use Capoeira strokes strategically to duel your colleagues, manage to introduce educational values ​​and elevate your group's experience. And be very careful! You will not want the police to hit your capoeira circle making your objective more difficult.

Are you ready to be part of the most known and respected Capoeira group in the world?

In Paranauê, you are a capoeira master who is disputing with other circles which is the strongest and most influential.
Join new members, produce instruments, duel and teach your values! At the end of the game, the player with the most Victory Points will be the winner.

Players take their turns until a player reaches the score according to the number of players below:
2 players - 25 points
3 and 4 players - 30 points
5 players - 35 points
When any player reaches the stipulated score the game will end as soon as the first player's turn begins.

So everyone adds up their
a deal with:

Victory Points - Your current score on the trail.
Objective Card - reveal your objective card. If you are finished, count the points.
Wheel members - Add the value of each member to the wheel.
Musical Instruments - Add the value of each instrument on the wheel.

boardgame.name: Campaign Map
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

At last! A large size playing sheet with 1 inch grid for FRP games. Usable with your 25mm figures.

boardgame.name: JAMIT
boardgame.description:
JAMIT is a new game with FILLIT components.
If you have one FILLIT set, you can play two different games!
Enjoy FILLIT & JAMIT!!

FILLIT : https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/262806/fillit

Push coins into game board from around like as pusher game.
You win when you get a certain number points as push coins out.
You should arrange your point coins to be advantageous.
This is very tactical and abstractry game.
You can enjoy this game with only FILLIT components.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Tales from the Loop Starter Set
boardgame.description:
From the back of the box:

Simon Stålenhag is the internationally lauded artist and author of "Tales From the Loop" and "Things From the Flood", narrative art books that stunned the world with a vision of an alternate Scandinavia in the 1980s and '90s where technology has invaded the tranquil landscapes to form an entirely new universe of the eerie and the nostalgic.

Now, you can step into the amazing world of the Loop. In this tabletop roleplaying game based on Simon Stålenhag's books, you'll play teenagers solving spectacular mysteries connected to the Loop - just make sure you're home in time for dinner. This Starter Set includes everything you need to begin:

An illustrated rulebook explaining how to play the game
A mystery called "The Recycled Boy"
Five pr-generated characters ready for you to play
A large, full-colour map of the land of the Loop
Ten engraved custom dice
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Historias del Bucle: Caja de Inicio

boardgame.name: Worldwide Football: Extension n°2
boardgame.description: An expansion for Worldwide Football including 6 new teams (Cameroon, Croatia, Netherlands, Portugal, South Korea, Uruguay) and 2 new Star abilities.

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 535 - Jun 2020)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 535
June 2020
It's common for books to have a character who turns out to be a royal heir. Have you ever had a PC or NPC who did that? Did they accept the position?

boardgame.name: World War One: A Miniature War Game
boardgame.description:
World War One is a miniature-based table top wargame aiming to recreate the battles that took place in the years 1914 – 1918, as well as in the early 1920s - such as the Polish – Bolshevik war of 1920-21

Smallest unit size in the game is the platoon.
Activation is done at the Company level.

Game is designed for 20mm (1/72nd)

boardgame.name: Bomber Boys
boardgame.description:
Bomber Boys is a dice rolling and dice allocation game with a WWII theme. You are managing the crew of an Allied aircraft during a series of air operations. To win, you have to complete each of the given missions, and each mission ends with a target that you have to bomb for a major victory. The game comes with five missions of progressive difficulty, and gameplay is based on a combination of decision making and luck.

Description from Solitaire Times website
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2020 Charles S. Roberts Amateur/Print & Play Wargame Nominee
2020 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Corona Wars: Survival
boardgame.description:
It is now 2026 post corona and mutants roam freely and you are the last of humanity’s remnants. You and your followers fight to escape the planet by any means necessary. Compete against other
factions in a race for resources, weapons and to be the only one to escape in a colonization ship.

Components
● DNA Deck- These cards come in 4 values and 2 different colors(back). 2,3,4 and 5. The 2 and 5 pieces have red backs, while the 3 and 4 pieces have greenbacks. Collecting these cards will help solve the molecular DNA crisis and create a cure for the COVID-Z21 virus. When any player accumulates a sum of 10 or more DNA, then the game can be won!
● Schematics Cards (52 card Deck) - Rare cards that will allow a faction to create a spaceship to escape the planet. Collect 15 schematics in order to win the game by leaving the rest of humanity behind in order to colonize the stars. Only 7 of these cards exist in the entire game!
● Survivor Deck - A deck of cards that have survivors in them. Each survivor has a unique ability which will improve your chances at surviving the epidemic. When all survivors are gone, game over!
● Tools Deck - This deck holds items and tools that can be used to survive the Zombie Plague. This includes weapons, defense tools , resources , med kits and more.
● Threat Deck - Cards which feature various zombie threats and humanoid threats courtesy of the Illuminati. Defeat zombies to harvest valuable DNA, while you must contend with illuminati threats to survive!

Set Up

● Determine turn order amongst yourselves.
● Each deck should be shuffled well before the game begins.
● Deal 5 cards from the Survivor deck to each player. In turn, each player should place their Survivor cards face up in front of them.
● Add the Schematics cards to the Tools Deck as well as the remainder of the Survivor Deck. Shuffle the new Tool Deck well.
● Each player should also now be dealt 3 cards from the Tools Deck. Place the remaining Tool Deck cards face down in the center of the play area.
● Place all of the remaining decks (Tool and Threat Decks) face down in the center of the playing area.

With this the game is ready to begin!

Rules

The purpose of the game is to collect a sum of 10 schematic cards, the first to do this wins. Players can choose to help or hinder each other during this process.

Alternatively, if any player manages to collect 20, DNA cards and to sacrifice 5 cards, the game will end!

You lose if:
1. Another player collects a sum of 20 or greater DNA material.
2. A player collects 10 schematics cards to complete the process of building an escape ship.
3. You lose all survivors in your faction.

Collecting DNA Cards
Perhaps the easiest way to win is to collect DNA cards. Each has a value listed on it which denotes the value of the DNA within. Collect a sum of 20 or more to win. This can be done in four ways:

● You can defeat a zombie to collect 1 DNA card.
● You can obtain them through bartering with other factions (players).
● You can steal or syphon them from other players.

Turns and Turn Actions

Each player has several actions they can take during a turn. These determine how the game progresses and are listed below:

1. Place a card in play. This varies based on type of card, but generally there are no limits to the amount of cards you can have / place in play throughout the duration of a game or in a single turn.

The exception to this is Survivor cards, of which you can only have a maximum of 10.
2. Draw a Threat card. This must be done every turn. You will either need to resolve your battle or you will have the freedom to take one or more other actions. [See Battle Resolution]
3. Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the DNA Deck.
4. Sacrifice 2 cards to draw from the Tools Deck.

Of these four potential actions, #1 and #4 have no limitation on the number of times they can be performed during a turn. #2 and #3 can only be performed once per turn.

Finally, the player must make sure they have no more than 6 cards of any type in their hand at the end of the round. If you have more than six cards in hand you must make a decision as to which you’d like to discard, or offer them to other players in order to make a deal.

Once a player has performed all four of, or the actions they desire to perform for that turn, turn order moves to the next person in gameplay. When it isn’t your turn there are a few things you can do as well.

1. Barter with other players. This includes assisting them, or bribing them so that you don’t hinder them.
2. Play cards against other players. This can come from your hand only, not previously active cards.

The game continues in this way until winning conditions are fulfilled by one faction player.

boardgame.name: Mächtige Monster: Queenie 1 – Häuptlinge
Mighty Monsters: Queenie 1 – Chieftains
boardgame.description: The chieftains are joining their fellow monsters to raid King Edgar's treasury. Each chieftain has a special ability that if used at the right moment can increase the amount of loot a player can collect in that round.

boardgame.name: Inkalam
boardgame.description:
High in the mountains, the realm of Inkalam is known for its fertile cornfields, herds of vigorous llamas, and the beauty of the lacustrine cities. But it’s especially his messengers’ guild, the Chascis, which makes it so famous.
Inkalam's prosperity depends on the quality of the messages transmitted by the Chascis. You will have to ensure the messages get delivered during a long day, from dawn to sunset.

The first player rolls the 3 dice, chooses one and puts it aside. Then all other players can choose one of the values presented by the 2-remaining dice.

Each player writes the chosen value on one of the Messages located on a Road starting from an already circled Messenger. Then they have to circle the Messenger at the other end of the Road.

If all the Messages located on the Roads surrounding a Region contain consecutive numbers (not necessarily in order), the player cross off a box of the Resource of this Region on their Scoreboard, starting with the lowest value. The next time for this Resource, the player will cross off the next higher value. At the end of the game, for each Resources (Lacustrine City, Corn Fields, and Lamas Herd), each player adds the value of the last box crossed off and the Speed Bonus if checked. Then player add the other bonus/malus of the game.

When you write on a Solar Message, check the Clock which tracks the game length. Once a player has checked the 8th sun on their clock, the game ends !

Add values for surrounded regions and any applicable speed bonuses and compare your scores.

Inkalam comes with two solo variants.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kleos
boardgame.description:
Equally feared and worshipped by mortals, monsters, and spirits alike, the Olympian Gods sit upon Mount Olympus and watch the world go by. That is, until word of the founding of a new city reaches their ears. Kleos, a city said to rival and eventually surpass even Troy and Athens. Zeus has declared a week-long contest among the gods to decide who shall be the patron god of this city-state. So call forth your champion, ready your armies, and use every divine power you possess to win at all costs. And remember, the gods do not play fair!

Kleos is a lightly asymmetrical game of strategic combat and area control. It combines hex-based combat with your favorite card game elements for a dynamic experience. Join the contest as one of five Greek Olympian Gods - Ares, Artemis, Hermes, Athena, or Dionysus - each with their own unique champion and divine deck.

Kleos features tactical card-play and action management. Play powerful blessings and curses to gain advantage. Summon Minions onto the board or use them as upgrades, serving as mounts or offerings to bolster their allies.

Command your forces during the action phase. Manage Minion actions for combat, area control, and tactical advantage. Send your Minions to the Greek Isles to recruit epic heroes and monsters of legend, such as Medusa, Perseus, and Pegasus. Organize your forces wisely. Positioning is key to victory!
Take the role of a Greek Olympian God, summon your champion, and compete for glory in the eyes of Zeus to be named the patron god of the rising Greek city-state, Kleos!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: MadCash
boardgame.description:
In MadCash, players start with nothing but the shirts on their backs and race to accumulate wealth any way they can. There are several ways players can accumulate cash, including getting jobs and gambling, but the trick is getting it into their bank account before they lose it.

The game board is a racetrack complete with a shortcut and spaces designed to create action or force decisions on every turn. Players use dice to move around the board and acquire Jobs (and a subsequent salary), receive Emails, collect cash payouts, and perform variety of other actions. Everyone starts by using dice and can use cash they collect to invest in other forms of transportation which allow them to strategically use up to 3 dice each roll, this also increases their job salary and the frequency at which they get paid.

There is a deck of Email cards with corresponding email spaces on the board that subject the players to a variety of events good and bad including salary increases, bills, and cards with the power to hinder other players' progress. Once players collect cash, they try to land on an ATM space in order to deposit into their bank account. Until a player's cash is safely deposited into the bank, it is fair game and can be stolen by other players, or lost in several other ways.

MadCash can be played individually or as teams with goal of accumulating a bank balance of $50,000. Game duration can vary greatly because of the volatility and unpredictability of the game play.

The game is designed in the tradition of other financial race games like Monopoly and Parker Brothers Full House, but with more of a ruthless, backstabbing element with no player ever truly being out of the race until the game is over.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Empower Empathy
boardgame.description:
Join the Super Squad to Resolve Social Dilemmas by Defending the City of Empathropolis against the Evil Villain Goobi!

WHAT THIS GAME IS ABOUT:
The citizens of the city Empathropolis have been under heavy emotional duress ever since the villain Goobi has made the city sewers his new home, Apathalypse.
He goes about town casting spells of emotional confusion on otherwise everyday, normal situations.

Fortunately, Empathropolis has its very own team of superheroes to the rescue!

As members of the Super Squad, you are thereby summoned to patrol and restore the City back to peace.

As you chase Goobi around the city, various City Watch scenarios are unveiled as you identify as many emotions and appropriate responses are at play. You will gain powers to strengthen your emotional powers and use them to banish Goobi back to his sewers.

This cooperative game and Exploration Guidebook help children develop emotional awareness and empathy with a positive growth mindset by transforming them into superheroes with superpowers that can resolve any social dilemma.

Our Teaching Approaches:

Step into 160+ unique City Watch Scenarios to be mindful with thoughts, feelings and actions
Master emotional awareness with 28 different feelings
Sharpen communication skills through self-reflection with 80+ Power Up cards
Exercise empathy every day with our easy-to-use evidence-based exploration guidebook
Learn and practice important emotional and communication skills while having silly fun!


Our Board Game Design:

Quick to set up
Easy to learn
Professional graphic designs
Self-contained inbox storage for easy cleanup
Extra Dense high-quality handmade game box for durability and keepsake
Custom made Double-A Extra High-Density Premium 5-ply 2.5mm white cardboard for all game components 
Printed with Soy Ink®
100% environmentally friendly and recyclable


Playing the Game:

Place all configurable City Blocks, Power Blocks, and Sewer Holes GRAY side up, RED side down in any slots on the board slots. Every single play will be different.
All Superheroes start at the Start Block; Goobi, the villain is placed at the center circle of the board, his Sewer.
Players spin to determine whether to move a Superhero or Goobi. Dice roll determines the number of steps to advance forward or the sewer number to emerge from.
If the spinner stops at either of the Superhero quadrants, the player may choose ANY Superhero game piece to move.
Whichever city block the Villain lands on, flip over the City Block to RED.
When Superhero lands on a RED City Block, player must draw a City Watch™ Scenario Card to assess the situation by using the Feeling Cards and the Thoughts-Feelings-Actions prompt.
After solving the scenario, the RED City Block can be turned back to normal - GRAY.
If a Superhero lands on a Power Block, the player must draw a Power-Up™ Card and discuss the question on the card. After discussion, player keeps the Power-Up™ Card to:


1) Send Goobi back to Sewer,
2) Select to turn over any RED City Block back to Gray, or
3) Make Goobi stay in the sewer at its turn.

If Goobi lands on a power block, it immediately goes back to its sewer.
If BOTH superhero and Goobi lands on the same block:


1) Superhero is thrown into the sewer,
2) The block turns RED, and
3) The rest of the super squad must use the Feelings Card deck (roll dice to determine how many feelings to select randomly) to act out. After the rescue, player rolls dice to determine which sewer hole the Superhero may emerge from.

To Win The Game:

Strategize with the entire team of Super Squad to turn most, if not all, RED City Blocks back to Gray.
All members of the Super Squad must pass the predetermined round (Start Block) to complete the mission.
Keep the Villain in his sewer to cause the least damage to the City Blocks.
Collect as many Power-Up Cards as you can to keep the Villain in his sewer and/or turn the Red city block back to gray.
Identify as many Emotions as you can with each City Watch™ patrol.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Shadow the Ronin - The Revenge to the Samurai
boardgame.description: Dokuganryū, a legendary samurai of ancient capital imperial was deprived and expelled from their lands, and all your family killed by the orders of the emperor. After these events, he swore vengeance against his opponents until death.

boardgame.name: Castaway Curse
boardgame.description:
You were passengers on a luxurious cruise en route for the Bahamas, but your ship has mysteriously capsized! Only a few survivors washed up on Prospero Island...

Each player takes on the role of an unfortunate castaway. You're trapped! The Ghost of Captain Dread Red has controlled and terrorized the island for hundreds of years. His curse keeps mortals imprisoned -- doomed to face torment until death.

Adapt quickly and develop your skills as a pirate to defeat him!

GAMEPLAY: Castaway Curse is a fast-paced, area control, shipwreck adventure game.

* Scavenge the island for resources (draw key and weapon cards)
* Raid areas of Prospero Island to earn doubloons.
* Set booby traps to keep command and defend your areas against raiding rivals.
* Complete Conquest Cards to advance your character and defeat Captain Dread Red.

The game is over once any player defeats the ghost of Captain Dread Red, but the player with the most doubloons wins the game!

boardgame.name: Guldjaktenspelet: Bamse och häxans dotter
boardgame.description:
Child game based on the movie swedish movie "Bamse och häxans dotter". Roll a die and collect gold from the lake. But watch out, Krösus Sork (the thief) wants to steal your gold.

On your turn you roll a dice and get either gold from the pond or diving equipment. If you are unlucky and hit the thief's symbol, you will lose gold. If you hit the "Bamses" symbol, he retrieves all the gold from the thief and gives it back to you. The first person to collect six gold dumplings wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Tanuki Matsuri
boardgame.description:
Tanuki live in the forest. They are pranksters and funny. But most of all, they are very greedy! They have stolen fruits from the little shop of Granny for the big tanuki party! Who will have the most beautiful table with the most guests? Will Grandma want to participate? Today is Tanuki Matsuri!

In this roll and write game taking place in the same universe as Tanuki Market, players roll dice and circle fruits on their sheet. Fruits give bonuses that players can chain together to create combos.

boardgame.name: Banditen!
boardgame.description:
"Banditen!" it is a tactical wargame covering two battles between Italian Partisans and forces of the R.S.I (Repubblica Sociale Italiana).

Tarnova is a simulation of the battle fought on 19-21 January 1945 at Tarnova della Selva, near Gorizia.

Gravellona Toce is a simulation of the battle fought on 12-14 December 1944 at Gravellona Toce, 110 km NE of Torino.

boardgame.name: ミックスジュースパーティー (Mix Juice Party)
boardgame.description:
ミックスジュースパーティー (Mix Juice Party) is a Japanese card game. The game proceeds mainly with card drafting; each player picks a card which they want to keep from their hand and reveals them together, then gives the remaining hand to the next player. Repeat this until last one card remains in the hand, which is discarded.

After drafting cards is over, each player makes a juice mix from the cards they kept. The player sorts their card by type of fruit, and then loses the highest card from the highest value fruit set.

Then players work out their total fruit mix value. If all the players have got a different total, the highest and lowest total players will lose milk (victory points). If some players have matching totals, those players lose milk instead.

The game ends when any player has lost all their milk. The final score is the total from the last round, plus the value of milk retained. Most points wins with heavenly milk!

Watch out for the cat cards. During the rounds, if a single cat appears, it steals fruit and the other players get no card. But if more than one cat appears, they run away together and no fruit is lost.

Keep away from losing your points and make nice juice by using three kind of fruits, honey, hot pepper, and special cards like the cat!

手札から欲しいカードを1枚選び、一斉に公開してから手札ををとなりに渡すドラフト形式でゲームは進行します。
ドラフトを行った後獲得したカードでジュースを作りその合計点数が他の人とかぶると失点です。
かぶった人がいなければ？最高点と最低点の人が失点となります。

一定の失点を獲得した人が出た時に集めていたカードの点数が最も高い人が勝者となります。
ですが、点数計算の前に自分が一番集めたフルーツはジュースにせずに食べてしまいます。
そして、ネコは今選んだカードを持って逃げてしまうので注意しましょう。

ゲームのメインはドラフト（与えられた手札から1枚選択し、残りを隣に渡して順にカードを集めていくシステム）となっております。

集めたカードの内合計値が最も高いフルーツは捨て札になります。
そして、残ったカードの合計値が他の人とかぶるとライフを失います（ミルクが1本なくなります）。
誰かがライフがなくなった時にゲームは終了し「その時点でのカードの合計値が高い人」が勝者となります
※最終ラウンドの点数しか見ません、ライフが残っていた分はボーナス点になります。

3種類のフルーツとハチミツとトウガラシ、そしてネコといった特殊カードをうまく使って失点を受けないようにうまくジュースを作りましょう！
publisher' summary

boardgame.name: Wrath & Glory Core Rulebook (Cubicle 7 Revised Edition)
Wrath & Glory Manuale Base
Wrath & Glory Podręcznik Główny
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Wrath & Glory is the story of the Gilead System, eight Imperial worlds cut off from the Emperor’s light by the Great Rift. The new Rulebook focuses on the Gilead System, allowing you to tell your own stories in a society beset by daemonic invasion and internal corruption.

Character Creation has been streamlined, with a focus on Frameworks. With so many choices of who and what you can play, you’ll want to decide the focus of your game early!

The Factions Chapter is a primer on life in the 41st Millennium, detailing each of the organisations vying for supremacy in the Warp-torn Gilead System. Here you’ll find expanded background options for every Faction, each of which provides a bonus during play.

The Archetypes you know and love have been presented in an easy-to-read, single-page format. All requirements have been removed, and extra bonuses have been added to complement the slight changes to Wrath & Glory. The Attribute, Skill, and Talent suggestions are ideal for guiding new players through making a character, or building quick NPCs on the fly.

The Wrath & Glory Talent list has been massively expanded into an entire chapter for a greater range of character customisation. Some of these are classic Warhammer fare we know and love — tearing through armour, proficiency with blazing promethium, and, of course, MORE DAKKA! There are other choices for investigative or social-based games. Talents like Conversational Cogitator bring the focus back to roleplaying, letting you use the augmetics of your mechanised mind to calculate the best response in any conversation.

Once you’ve survived a few adventures (hopefully without losing too many limbs), you’ll have gathered some Experience Points (XP). The new Advancement chapter has overhauled the Ascension system, allowing you to change Archetypes, take new Ascension Packages, or just spend your XP on cool stuff. The system is designed to be both robust and flexible to suit any group.

The essential Rules have been reviewed, edited, playtested, and presented with a focus on clarity and quick understanding. Very little has changed bar a few simplifications, which will mean you’re using the book less and your imagination more.

Combat is around every corner in the grim darkness of the 41st Millennium. We’ve gone through all the errata for Wrath & Glory, taking the same approach as with the Rules. Combat is largely unchanged, apart from simplification, clarification, and some cool new optional rules, including an entirely new Stealth system.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Wrath & Glory Manuale Base - Italian PDF Edition

listing.notes: New and unused! ask us about the wrath tokens and card pack accessories we have in stock! Such as Wargear, Talents and Pisonics, combat complications, and more!

boardgame.name: Three Kingdoms, modern naval battles
日中韓・現代海戦三国志
現代海戦三国志
現代海戦三国志
boardgame.description:
Japan-China-Korea; Three Kingdoms Modern Naval Battles is a board simulation game that depicts the possible conflict between the Japanese Maritime Self-Defense Force, the Chinese Navy and the Korean Navy that could be fought in 202x.

In this simulation, each surface ship/submarine is one unit, and each unit has anti-ship, anti-air, anti-submarine power, and technical level. In addition, wide area anti-air power must be set for Aegis warship. The character of each individual ship and each weapon is reproduced.

As a result, various modern naval battles including ship-to-ship, ship-to-air, ship-to-submarine, air-to-submarine, and air-to-air combat are reproduced with a simple game system, enabling you to play a three-dimensional modern naval-air battle.

In addition to four introductory scenarios that can be played in a short period of time, a campaign scenario that requires a plan of operations combining surface, submarine, and aircraft units on a wide scale is also included.

198 counters
1 full map
Time scale: 16 hours to 3 days (depending on scenario)
Unit scale: 1 ship /Several aircrafts
Game area: West Japan Sea and East China Sea

Scenarios:
・Dokdo ship, sortie! (Introduction scenario: Japan vs Korea)
・Senkaku offshore carrier battle (Introduction scenario: Japan vs China)
・Jeju Island Defense War (Introduction scenario: China vs South Korea)
・Aircraft carrier Izumo (Introduction scenario: Japan vs ?)
・Sakishima Islands Campaign (Main scenario: Japan vs China)

(translated and adapted from publisher's Japanese description)


Issue game of Game Journal #74.

boardgame.name: Family Man
boardgame.description:
Family Man is a first-person story-led RPG that asks the question: When pushed to the limits of your own morality, how far would you go for the sake of your family?

You owe money to the mob, and you've got 30 days to pay it back. Will you flip burgers and earn an honest living while scraping the money together... or will you take on some dirty jobs for more cash, but potentially push your family away?

Every decision you make not only affects the neighborhood, but directly affects your family. Your choices impact how your family sees you, and can lead to your household becoming stronger than ever... or the breakdown of your marriage and relationship with your son.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Super Mega Baseball 3
boardgame.description:
Run up the score in a relaxed slugfest or push the limits of your reflexes in this refined baseball simulator. Super Mega Baseball 3 features an all-new Franchise mode, major graphical enhancements, and on-field additions including pickoffs and situational player traits.

Baseball Simulation

Apply and refine your baseball instincts with a sophisticated baseball simulation featuring new pick-off and stealing mechanics, wild pitches and passed balls, designated hitters, and situational player traits.

Ego Difficulty System

Challenge your hand-eye coordination or relax and hit dingers with fluid gameplay that scales seamlessly from novice to beyond-expert levels of difficulty.

Customize

Create your ideal league with a comprehensive customization suite that includes season length/structure, team names/uniforms/logos, and player names/appearance/attributes.

Ballparks

Take in the sights and sounds of 14 richly detailed ballparks, each featuring unique day, night and alternate lighting conditions.

Franchise

Guide an evolving team to greatness over multiple seasons in the all new Franchise mode featuring player development, aging, retirement and signing/releasing of free agents.

Compete Online

Compete online to win pennants and climb to higher divisions in the cross-platform Pennant Race mode.

Season & Elimination

Play or simulate any combination of games/teams in customized Seasons and Elimination brackets, solo or with friends.

Play Ball

Skip customization and compete for top leaderboard scores with standardized teams and settings (locked player attributes) in Standard Season and Standard Elimination modes.

Source: The Game Website.
